sourceDesc.p: Born digital; generated by meiDocBook2TEI.xsl, v. 0.1

div.head: Description:
div.p: A generic element for a shortened form of a word, including an acronym. The type attribute may be used to classify the abbreviation according to some convenient typology. Sample values include: suspension - the abbreviation provides the first letter(s) of the word or phrase, omitting the remainder; contraction - the abbreviation omits some letter(s) in the middle; brevigraph - the abbreviation comprises a special symbol or mark; superscription - the abbreviation includes writing above the line; acronym - the abbreviation comprises the initial letters of the words of a phrase; title - the abbreviation is for a title of address (Dr, Ms, Mr, ...); organization - the abbreviation is for the name of an organization; geographic - the abbreviation is for a geographic name. This tag is the mirror image of the <expan> tag; both allow the encoder to transcribe both an abbreviation and its expansion. In <abbr>, however, the original is transcribed as the content of the element and the expansion as an attribute value; <expan> reverses this. The choice between the two is up to the user. The <abbr> tag is not required; if appropriate, the encoder may transcribe abbreviations in the source text silently, without tagging them. If abbreviations are not transcribed directly but expanded silently, then the MEI header should so indicate. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the expansion of the abbreviation. The expan attribute gives an expansion of the abbreviation. The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor or transcriber responsible for supplying the expansion of the abbreviation.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, annot, bibl, choice, corpname, corr, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, name, num, orig, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, title, unclear

list.item:
cert, data.CERTAINTY, optional
signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.

evidence, NMTOKEN, optional
indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation. Suggested values include: 'internal', 'external', 'conjecture'.

expan, TEXT, optional
records the expansion of the abbreviation.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

hand, IDREF, optional
signifies the hand of the agent which made the intervention. Its value must be the ID of a <hand> element declared in the header.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

resp, IDREFS, optional
records the editor(s) responsible for asserting a particular reading in a witness. Its value must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

seq, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
used to assign a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Describes the conditions that affect the accessibility of material. May indicate the nature of restrictions or the lack of restrictions. Do not confuse this element with <userestrict> (usage restrictions), which captures information about limitations on the use of material, such as those afforded by copyright.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: This element captures a temporary alteration to the pitch of a note. It provides an alternative to the accid attributes on the <note> element. The element should be used when specific display info, such as size or color, needs to be recorded for the accidental or when multiple accidentals occur on a single note. The func attribute can be used to differentiate different functions, such as 'cautionary' or 'editorial'.

list.item:
color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

enclose, data.ENCLOSURE, optional
records the characters often used to mark the accidental as having an cautionary or editorial function. For an example of cautionary accidentals enclosed in parentheses, see Read, p. 131, ex. 9-14.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fontfam, data.FONTFAMILY, optional
contains the name of a font-family.

fontname, data.FONTNAME, optional
records the name of the font.

fontsize, data.NUMBER, optional
indicates the size of the font in printers' points, i.e., 1/72ths of an inch.

fontstyle, data.FONTSTYLE, optional
records the style of the font, i.e, italic, oblique, or normal.

fontweight, data.FONTWEIGHT, optional
used to indicate bold type.

func, TOKEN, optional
If an accidental has an editorial or cautionary function, its function may be captured in the func attribute.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, TOKEN, optional
captures the placement of the accidental relative to the staff.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

value, data.ACCIDENTAL.EXPLICIT, required
records a written accidental.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Marks an addition to the musical text. The add element contains material inserted by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector. The agent responsible for the addition may be encoded using the hand attribute, while the resp attribute records the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the hand of the addition. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the identification of the hand of the addition.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Page-anchored text. The content model here is similar to paragraph without model.textcomponent and <pb> sub-elements. The starting point of the text may be identified in absolute output coordinate terms using the x and y attributes or relative to the location of another element using the startid attribute. The attributes in the att.visualoffset class may be used to record horizontal, vertical, or time offsets from the absolute coordinates or from the location of the referenced element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Provides a short statement explaining the text or indicating the basis for an assertion. It is used for both general comments and for an annotation of the musical text. <annot> provides a way to group participating *events* and/or *control events*, the notes that form a descending bass line or phrase marks, for example, and provide a label for or comment regarding the group. A list of event IDs may be given in the plist attribute. An editorial or analytical comment or observation, encoded elsewhere, such as in the front or back matter, in score text elements, or in an external document may be pointed to using the link.common, link.internal, or link.external attributes. Alternatively, the observation may be included directly within the <annot> element. The <annot> element, along with other elements with attributes from the att.link.external class, may also be used to link/synchronize elements within the MEI file to external media such as images or sound recordings. The ID of the MEI element(s) to be linked from should be encoded in the plist attribute while the link to the external media may be encoded in the href or entityref attributes or in the body of the annotation using <extref> or <extptr> elements. The starting point of the annotation may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges or endid attribute.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, annot, bibl, blockquote, choice, corpname, corr, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, lg, list, name, num, orig, p, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, table, title, unclear

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dur, data.MEASUREBEAT, optional
records the durational scope of the annotation. Please note that the dur attribute is not a true duration, but rather a time stamp for the end point of the directive.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records the durational scope of the annotation when it differs from the written values of the participants. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

entityref, ENTITY, optional
uses a previously-declared entity to identify an external electronic object.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fragment, data.FRAGMENT, optional
permits identification of one or more sub-parts within the object being pointed to.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which an annotation applies.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
contains an ID reference for each of the participants in a collection of elements.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

resp, IDREFS, optional
records the editor(s) responsible for identifying or creating the annotation. Its value must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff to which an annotation applies.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
title, TEXT, optional

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

xlink:actuate, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:href, data.URI, optional
allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

xlink:role, ANYURI, optional
indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains one or more alternative encodings. The alternatives may be thought of as exclusive or as parallel. The type attribute may contain any convenient descriptive word, describing the extent of the variation (e.g. note, phrase, measure, etc.), its text-critical significance (e.g. significant, accidental, unclear), or the nature of the variation or the principles required to understand it (e.g. lectio difficilior, usus auctoris, etc.).

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Indicates that the notes of a chord are to be performed successively rather than simultaneously, usually from lowest to highest. Sometimes called a 'roll'. The usual symbol is a vertical wavy line preceding the chord.

list.item:
arrow, data.BOOLEAN, optional
may be used when an arrowhead is to be drawn as part of the arpeggiation symbol.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dir, TOKEN, optional
describes the direction in which the arpeggio is to be performed; "nonarp" indicates a non-arpeggiated chord, usually rendered with a preceding bracket instead of a wavy line.

regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An indication of how to play a note or chord. Articulations typically affect duration, such as staccato marks, or the force of attack, such as accents. This element provides an alternative to the artic attributes on the <note> and <chord> elements. It should be used when specific display info, such as size or color, needs to be recorded for the articulation or when multiple articulation marks occur on a single note or chord.

list.item:
color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

enclose, data.ENCLOSURE, optional
encodes the characters used to enclose the accidental when it has a cautionary or editorial function.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fontfam, data.FONTFAMILY, optional
contains the name of a font-family.

fontname, data.FONTNAME, optional
records the name of the font.

fontsize, data.NUMBER, optional
indicates the size of the font in printers' points, i.e., 1/72ths of an inch.

fontstyle, data.FONTSTYLE, optional
records the style of the font, i.e, italic, oblique, or normal.

fontweight, data.FONTWEIGHT, optional
used to indicate bold type.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, optional
captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

value, data.ARTICULATIONS, required
records the name of the articulation symbol drawn from the list given in data.ARTICULATIONS.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Groups elements that describe the availability of and access to a bibliographic item, including the MEI-encoded document itself.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Back matter such as indexes, advertisements, etc. following the main part of a text.

list.item:
facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Vertical line that divides musical notation into metrical units. This element is provided as an alternative to the <measure> container.

list.item:
barplace, data.BARPLACE, optional
records the location of the barline.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

complete, TOKEN, optional
allows the encoding of whether the measure preceding this barline matches the prevailing meter: a value of 'c' indicates a metrically complete measure, 'i' indicates a measure with not enough beats, while 'o' is for measures with too many beats.

control, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates whether or not the barline is "controlling"; that is, if it indicates a point of alignment across all the parts. Barlines within a score are usually controlling' that is, they "line up". Barlines within parts may or may not be controlling.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

entityref, ENTITY, optional
uses a previously-declared entity to identify an external electronic object.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fragment, data.FRAGMENT, optional
permits identification of one or more sub-parts within the object being pointed to.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
contains an ID reference for each of the participants in a collection of elements.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

rend, data.BARRENDITION, optional
records the appearance of the barline.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

taktplace, data.STAFFLOC, optional
If takt barlines are to be used, then the taktplace attribute may be used to denote the staff location of the shortened barline. The location may include staff lines, spaces, and the spaces directly above and below the staff. The value ranges between 0 (just below the staff) to 2 * number of staff lines (directly above the staff). For example, on a 5-line staff the lines would be numbered 1,3,5,7, and 9 while the spaces would be numbered 0,2,4,6,8,10. For example, a value of '9' puts the barline through the top line of a 5-line staff.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
title, TEXT, optional

tstamp, TEXT, optional
encodes the onset time of the barline in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

width, data.NUMBER, optional
For rendering purposes, some music data systems rely on measure width data. The width attribute allows for the capture of this data in MEI for output back to these systems.

xlink:actuate, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:href, data.URI, optional
allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

xlink:role, ANYURI, optional
indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An indication of fingering in a chord tablature grid. The from and to attributes should each contain the id of a <chordmember> element.

list.item:
fret, data.FRET, required
indicates the fret at which the barre should be created.

from, IDREF, required
captures the starting note of the barre.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

to, IDREF, required
indicates the ending note of the barre.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A container for a series of explicitly beamed events that begins and ends entirely within a measure. For beams that cross the barline, use the beamspan element. Secondary beams may be broken explicitly using the breaksec attribute on the notes or chords under the beam. Automated beaming, as opposed to explicitly marked beams, may be indicated for an entire score, part or section by using the beamgroup attribute on these elements.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: barline, beam, beatrpt, bend, btrem, chord, clefchange, custos, ftrem, gliss, halfmrpt, keysig, ligature, mensur, note, pad, proport, rest, space, tuplet

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

rend, TOKEN, optional
captures whether a beam is feathered and in which direction: 'acc' indicates that the secondary beams get progressively closer together, coming together at the end of the beam, while 'rit' means that the secondary beams start at the same point and get progressively more distant.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

slope, data.NUMBER, optional
records the slope of the beam.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

with, data.PLACE, optional
In the case of cross-staff beams, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Alternative element for explicitly encoding beams which extend across barlines. The starting point of the beam may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges or endid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify one starting and one ending type of attribute.

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dur, data.MEASUREBEAT, optional
encodes the logical and visual duration of the beam. Please note that the dur attribute is not a true duration, but rather a time stamp for the end point of the trill.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

rend, TOKEN, optional
captures whether a beam is feathered and in which direction: 'acc' indicates that the secondary beams get progressively closer together, coming together at the end of the beam, while 'rit' means that the secondary beams start at the same point and get progressively more distant.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

slope, data.NUMBER, optional
records the slope of the beam.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

with, data.PLACE, optional
In the case of cross-staff beams, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An indication that material on a preceding beat should be repeated.

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

expand, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates whether to render the repeated beat symbol or the source material.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

rend, data.BEATRPT.REND, required
indicates the number of slashes required to render the appropriate beat repeat symbol when the beat is divided into even notes: 4ths or 8ths=1, 16ths=2, 32nds=3, 64ths=4, 128ths=5. When the beat is comprised of mixed duration values, the symbol is always rendered as 2 slashes and 2 dots. See Read, pg. 223-224.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A variation in pitch (often microtonal) upwards or downwards during the course of a note. Typically, the performer attacks the note at "true" pitch, bends the intonation, then returns to true pitch. The bend element can also be used for scoop, plop, falloff, and doit performance effects. It should *not* be used for l.v. (laissez vibrer) indications. Precise performance data that differs from the logical events in a measure may be recorded within the bend element. The starting point of the bend may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting attribute.

list.item:
amount, data.BEND.AMOUNT, optional
records the amount of detuning. The decimal values should be rendered as a fraction (or an integer plus a fraction) along with the bend symbol.

bezier, NMTOKENS, optional
records the placement of Bezier control points as a series of space-separated xy coordinates, eg. 19 45 -32 118.

bulge, NMTOKENS, optional
describes the curve as a set of distance values above or below an imaginary line connecting the endpoints of the curve. The bulge attribute must contain one or more values of type NUMBER.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

endho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

endto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endvo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

rend, data.CURVERENDITION, optional
records the appearance of the curve or line.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

startto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startvo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

x2, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional 2nd x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

y2, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional 2nd y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Provides a citation for a published work. <bibref> may contain a mix of text and more specific elements such as <title>, <edition>, <persname>, and <corpname>. This element may also function as a hypertext reference to an external electronic resource. Do not confuse this element with <ref>, which is an internal link from one place in the MEI document to another place in the same document.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, annot, bibl, corpname, date, edition, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

list.item:
entityref, ENTITY, optional
uses a previously-declared entity to identify an external electronic object.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fragment, data.FRAGMENT, optional
permits identification of one or more sub-parts within the object being pointed to.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
title, TEXT, optional

xlink:actuate, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:href, data.URI, optional
allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

xlink:role, ANYURI, optional
indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A formatting element that designates an extended quotation; that is, a passage attributed to a source external to the text. The quotation is normally set off from the text by spacing or other typographic distinction. The source for the quote may be included in the optional <bibl> sub-element. Use <rend> for words that are enclosed in quotation marks for emphasis or for a short quoted phrase that occurs within a line of text.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: bibl, blockquote, lg, list, p, table

list.item:
facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: This element contains the actual music data of the MEI encoding, as opposed to the header, front, and back elements, which do not. When the music can be broken into high-level, discrete, linear segments, such as movements of a symphony, there may be multiple <mdiv> elements within this element. This is the highest level indication of the structure of the music.

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: The breath element is a specialized form of, i.e., syntactic sugar for, dir/@type="breathmark" with "," (comma) as its PCDATA content. The starting point of the breath mark may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, optional
captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A rapid alternation on a single pitch or chord. This element should also be used for wind double and triple tonguing and for flutter tonguing when these are expressed as tremolandi.

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

form, TOKEN, optional
describes the bowed tremolo as measured or unmeasured.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
used to store a number to be rendered along with the note. See Read, p. 394, ex. 23-21, line 5.

num.place, data.PLACE, optional
records where the number accompanying the tremolo note or chord should be rendered.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

slash, data.SLASH, optional
indicates the number of slashes to be drawn. The number of slashes indicates the exact note values in an aural rendition of measured tremolandi, i.e., 4ths or 8ths=1, 16ths=2, 32nds=3, 64ths=4, 128ths=5, 256ths=6. See Read, p. 393-394. The stem modifier (slash or z) must also be explicity set on the child <note> or <chord> element for a complete visual representation.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A label which accompanies an illustration or a table.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, annot, bibl, choice, corpname, corr, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, name, num, orig, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, title, unclear

list.item:
facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: MIDI parameter/control change. The num attribute specifies parameter number, while val contains the parameter value. Each must fall in the range 0-127.

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.MIDIVALUE, required
holds the number of the MIDI controller.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff to which the MIDI event applies.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the MIDI event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

val, data.MIDIVALUE, required
records the MIDI controller's value.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

records the MIDI channel value.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff to which the MIDI event applies.

when, IDREF, optional
