div.head: Description:
div.p: Individual change within the revision description. Additions, deletions, and significant recoding should be noted, but not correction of minor typographical errors. It is recommended that revisions should be entered in reverse chronological order, with the most recent <change> first. The resp attribute contains a pointer to an element containing info about the person/entity responsible for change. The edition element can be used to designate an MEI encoding that has been so substantively changed that it constitutes a new version that supersedes earlier versions.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Description of a revision of the MEI file.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: MIDI channel pressure/after touch. The value of the num attribute must be in the range 0-127.

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.MIDIVALUE, required
records the pressure/after touch value.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff to which the MIDI event applies.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the MIDI event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Groups a number of alternative encodings for the same point in a text. Because the children of a choice element all represent alternative ways of encoding the same sequence, it is natural to think of them as mutually exclusive. However, there may be cases where a full representation of a text requires the alternative encodings to be considered as parallel. Note also that choice elements may be recursively nested.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: abbr, choice, corr, expan, orig, reg, sic, unclear

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A simultaneous sounding of 2 or more notes in the same layer *with the same duration*.

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

artic, data.ARTICULATIONS, optional
encodes the written articulation(s). Articulations are normally encoded in order from the notehead outward; that is, away from the stem. See additional notes at att.vis.note. Only articulations should be encoded in the artic attribute; fingerings should be encoded using the <dir> element.

artic.ges, data.ARTICULATIONS, optional
records performed articulation that differs from the written value.

beam, data.BEAMS, optional
indicates that this event is "under a beam".

beam.with, data.PLACE, optional
In the case of cross-staff beams, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

breaksec, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
presence of this attribute indicates that the secondary beam should be broken following this note/chord. The value of the attribute records the number of beams which should remain unbroken.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.
detune, TEXT, optional

dot.ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal offset of the augmentation dot from its "normal", programmatically determined position.

dot.vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical offset of the augmentation dot from its "normal", programmatically determined position.

dot.x, data.NUMBER, optional
records the absolute horizontal position of the augmentation dot.

dot.y, data.NUMBER, optional
records the absolute vertical position of the augmentation dot.

dots, data.AUGMENTDOT, optional
encodes the number of written dots of augmentation.

dur, data.DURATION, optional
encodes logical; that is, written, duration.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fermata, data.PLACE, optional
indicates the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a <fermata> element should be employed.

grace, data.GRACE, optional
marks this chord as a grace and records from which note/chord it should "steal" time.

grace.time, data.PERCENT, optional
records the amount of time to be "stolen" from a non-grace note/chord.

headshape, data.CLUSTER, optional
indicates an alternative notehead should be displayed instead of individual noteheads. See Read, p. 320-321, re: tone clusters.

hfunc, TEXT, optional
describes the chord's harmonic function in any convenient typology.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

instr, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

lv, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates the attachment of an l.v. (laissez vibrer) sign to this element.

mfunc, TEXT, optional
describes the chord's melodic function in any convenient typology.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

size, data.SIZE, optional
describes the relative size of the chord.

slur, data.SLURS, optional
indicates that this element participates in a slur.

slur.dir, data.SLURDIRECTION, optional
indicates the direction of a slur.

slur.rend, TOKEN, optional
describes the rendering style for slurs.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

stem.dir, data.STEMDIRECTION, optional
describes the direction of a stem.

stem.len, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the stem length.

stem.mod, data.STEMMODIFIER, optional
encodes any stem "modifiers"; that is, symbols rendered on the stem, such as tremolo or Sprechstimme indicators.

stem.pos, data.STEMPOSITION, optional
records the position of the stem in relation to the notehead(s).

stem.with, data.PLACE, optional
contains an indication of which staff a note or chord that logically belongs to the current staff should be visually placed on.

stem.x, data.NUMBER, optional
records the x coordinate of the stem's attachment point.

stem.y, data.NUMBER, optional
records the y coordinate of the stem's attachment point.

syl, TEXT, optional
holds an associated sung text syllable.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tie, data.TIE, optional
indicates that this element participates in a tie. If visual information about the tie needs to be recorded, then a <tie> element should be employed.

tie.dir, data.TIEDIRECTION, optional
determines the direction of a tie.

tie.rend, TOKEN, optional
describes the rendering style of a tie.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

tuplet, data.TUPLET, optional
indicates that this element participates in a tuplet.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Chord tablature definition. An id attribute, while not required by the schema, is needed so that <harm> elements can reference a particular chord definition. The pos (position) attribute is provided in order to create displayable chord tablature grids.

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

pos, TEXT, optional
records the fret position at which the chord tablature is to be played.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An individual pitch in a chord defined by a <chorddef> element. The fing and fret attributes are provided in order to create displayable chord tablature grids. The inth (harmonic interval) attribute may be used to facilitate automated performance of a chord. It gives the number of 1/2 steps above the bass. Of course, for the bass note itself, inth should be set to '0'.

list.item:
accid, data.ACCIDENTAL.IMPLICIT, optional
captures the performed accidental symbol.

fing, data.FINGER.FRET, optional
indicates which finger, if any, should be used to play an individual string. The values 'x' and 'o' indicated stopped and open strings, respectively.

fret, data.FRET, optional
indicates at which the fret a finger should be placed.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

inth, TEXT, optional
encodes the harmonic interval from a pitch occuring at the same time.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

oct, data.OCTAVE, optional
captures written octave information.

pname, data.PITCHNAME, required
contains the written pitch name.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Chord/tablature look-up table. A table may be shared between MEI instances through the use of an external parsed entity containing the look-up table to be shared.

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Library of Congress subject or call number, or a thesaurus or ontology citation, for example. The source of controlled-vocabulary terms used in the <keywords> element.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Groups information which describes the nature or topic of a musical work. Although use of names and terms from locally controlled vocabularies is possible, terms used here should come from standard national or international vocabularies whenever they are available in order to enable searches in systems that include multiple MEI documents, or MEI documents and bibliographic records from many institutions.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Indication of the exact location of a particular note on the staff and, therefore, the other notes as well. This element provides an alternative to the staff element's clef.* attributes. It should be used when specific display info, such as size or color, needs to be recorded for the clef or when multiple, simultaneous clefs occur on a single staff.

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dis, data.OCTAVE.DIS, optional
records the amount of octave displacement to be applied to the clef.

dis.place, data.PLACE, optional
records the direction of octave displacement to be applied to the clef.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

line, data.CLEFLINE, required
the staff location of the clef. The value must be in the range between 1 and the number of lines on the staff.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

octave.default, data.OCTAVE, optional
The default octave, used when the first note of a measure provides no oct attribute, is set by the octave.default attribute.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

shape, data.CLEFSHAPE, required
decribes the clef symbol.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A change of clef not occurring at a barline.

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dis, data.OCTAVE.DIS, optional
records the amount of octave displacement to be applied to the clef.

dis.place, data.PLACE, optional
records the direction of octave displacement to be applied to the clef.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

line, data.CLEFLINE, optional
records the position of the clef. The value must be in the range between 1 and the number of lines on the staff.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

octave.default, data.OCTAVE, optional
sets the value of the oct attribute of the event following the clefchange, if the event doesn't already have an oct attribute.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

shape, data.CLEFSHAPE, optional
indicates the shape of the clef symbol.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: The physical condition of an item, particularly any variances between the physical makeup of the item and that of other copies of the same item (e.g., missing pages, plates, etc.). Condition may reflect other aspects of the physical condition of the item as well (e.g., brittleness, faded images, etc.).

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Identifies an organization or group of people that acts as a single entity. Examples include names of associations, institutions, business firms, non-profit enterprises, governments, government agencies, projects, programs, religious bodies, churches, conferences, athletic contests, exhibitions, expeditions, fairs, and ships. Secondary name parts may be encoded in <corpname> sub-elements.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, annot, bibl, choice, corpname, corr, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, name, num, orig, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, title, unclear

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

authority, TEXT, optional
contains the name of the list from which a controlled value is taken, such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names (TGN), etc.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

key, NMTOKEN, optional
used to record a value which serves as a primary key in an external database.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

reg, TEXT, optional
used to record a regularized form of the name.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains the correct form of an apparent erroneous passage. The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor or transcriber responsible for suggesting the correction held as the content of the <corr> element. If the correction was made in the source, resp should be used to identify the hand of the corrector.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, accid, add, address, annot, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, bibl, breath, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corpname, corr, custos, damage, date, del, dir, dot, dynam, expan, extptr, extref, fermata, fig, ftrem, gap, geogname, gliss, hairpin, halfmrpt, handshift, harm, harppedal, identifier, ineume, keysig, layer, lb, ligature, lyrics, measure, mensur, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, name, note, num, octave, orig, pad, pb, pedal, periodname, persname, phrase, proport, ptr, ref, reg, reh, rend, repository, rest, restore, section, sic, slur, space, stack, staff, stylename, subst, supplied, tempo, tie, title, trill, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, unclear, uneume

list.item:
cert, data.CERTAINTY, optional
signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.

evidence, NMTOKEN, optional
indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation. Suggested values include: 'internal', 'external', 'conjecture'.

hand, IDREF, optional
signifies the hand of the agent which made the intervention. Its value must be the ID of a <hand> element declared in the header.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

resp, IDREFS, optional
records the editor(s) responsible for asserting a particular reading in a witness. Its value must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

seq, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
used to assign a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

div.head: Description:
div.p: States how and under what circumstances corrections have been made in the musical text.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

method, TOKEN, optional
indicates the method employed to mark corrections.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

status, TOKEN, optional
indicates the degree of correction applied to the text.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Non-bibliographic creation details for the work being encoded, in narrative form. Contains phrases describing the origin of the text, e.g. the date, place, and circumstances of its composition.

analog, TEXT, optional

provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A curved line that cannot be represented by a more specific element, such as a <slur>. The starting point of the curve may be identified in absolute output coordinate terms using the x1 and y1 attributes or relative to the location of another element using the startid attribute. The attributes in the att.visualoffset class may be used to record horizontal, vertical, or time offsets from the absolute coordinates or from the location of the referenced element. Similarly, the terminal point of the curve may be recorded using either the x2,y2 coordinates or in relation to the location of another element using the endid attribute. Attributes in the att.visualoffset2 class maybe used to record the offsets of the ending point. The bulge attribute or, alternatively, the bezier attribute, describes the shape of the curve. The bulge attribute describes the curve as a set of distance values above or below an imaginary line connecting the endpoints of the curve while the bezier attribute records the placement of Bezier control points as a series of space-separated xy coordinate pairs, eg. 19 45 -32 118. The bulge attribute must contain one or more values of the NUMBER datatype. The rend attribute captures the appearance of the curve.

list.item:
bezier, NMTOKENS, optional
records the placement of Bezier control points as a series of space-separated xy coordinates, eg. 19 45 -32 118.

bulge, NMTOKENS, optional
describes the curve as a set of distance values above or below an imaginary line connecting the endpoints of the curve. The bulge attribute must contain one or more values of type NUMBER.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

endho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

endto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endvo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

rend, data.CURVERENDITION, optional
records the appearance of the curve.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

startho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

startto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startvo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

x2, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional 2nd x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

y2, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional 2nd y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: The symbol placed at the end of a staff to indicate the first note of the next staff. Sometimes called a "direct".

list.item:
color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

facs, IDREFS, optional

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

oct, data.OCTAVE, required
together with the pname attribute, identifies the location where the custos appears.

pname, data.PITCHNAME, required
in conjuction with the oct attribute, identifies the location where the custos appears.

points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

source, IDREFS, optional

points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

encodes the target note when its pitch differs from the pitch at which the custos appears.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains an area of damage to the carrier. In the case of damage resulting from an identifiable cause, the agent attribute signifies the causative agent. The degree attribute signifies the degree of damage according to a convenient scale. A <damage> tag with this attribute should only be used where the text may be read with some confidence; data supplied from other sources should be tagged as <supplied>. The extent attribute indicates approximately how much text is in the damaged area, in notes, measures, inches, or any appropriate unit, where this cannot be deduced from the contents of the tag. For example, the damage may span structural divisions in the text so that the tag must then be empty of content. In the case of damage (deliberate defacement, etc.) assignable to an identifiable hand, the hand attribute signifies the hand responsible for the damage.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, accid, add, address, annot, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, bibl, breath, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corpname, corr, custos, damage, date, del, dir, dot, dynam, expan, extptr, extref, fermata, fig, ftrem, gap, geogname, gliss, hairpin, halfmrpt, handshift, harm, harppedal, identifier, ineume, keysig, layer, lb, ligature, lyrics, measure, mensur, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, name, note, num, octave, orig, pad, pb, pedal, periodname, persname, phrase, proport, ptr, ref, reg, reh, rend, repository, rest, restore, section, sic, slur, space, stack, staff, stylename, subst, supplied, tempo, tie, title, trill, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, unclear, uneume

list.item:

signifies the causative agent of the damage.

records the degree of damage.

extent, TEXT, optional

hand, IDREF, optional
signifies the hand responsible for the damage in the case of damage (deliberate defacement, inking out, etc.) assignable to a distinct hand.

regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains information deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector. The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the hand of the deletion. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the identification of the hand of the deletion. The hand of the agent which made the deletion should be pointed to using the hand attribute. The rend attribute may be used to record the method used to make the deletion (overstrike, strike[through], etc.) or how the deleted matter should be displayed.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, accid, add, address, annot, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, bibl, breath, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corpname, corr, custos, damage, date, del, dir, dot, dynam, expan, extptr, extref, fermata, fig, ftrem, gap, geogname, gliss, hairpin, halfmrpt, handshift, harm, harppedal, identifier, ineume, keysig, layer, lb, ligature, lyrics, measure, mensur, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, name, note, num, octave, orig, pad, pb, pedal, periodname, persname, phrase, proport, ptr, ref, reg, reh, rend, repository, rest, restore, section, sic, slur, space, stack, staff, stylename, subst, supplied, tempo, tie, title, trill, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, unclear, uneume

regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

used to assign a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Information about the physical size of a bibliographic source; usually includes numerical data. There are no height and width sub-elements; however, num sub-elements may be used with appropriate n attribute values. Measurements may be expressed in any convenient unit. Do not confuse this element with the <extent> element, which is used to indicate the quantity of described materials.

analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

unit, TEXT, optional
indicates the unit of measurement of the dimensions.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A text expression that is on the score (typically above, below, or between staves), but not on the staff and not encoded elsewhere in more specific elements, such as <tempo> or <dynam>. Examples include text strings, such as 'affettuoso' or fingerings and music symbols, such as segno and coda symbols, fermatas over a barline, etc. Unlike generic text elements, directives can be control elements. That is, they can be used as pointers to other events. The starting point of the directive may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges or endid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, anchoredtext, bibl, choice, corpname, corr, curve, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, line, name, num, orig, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, symbol, title, unclear

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dur, data.MEASUREBEAT, optional
encodes the logical and visual durations of the directive. If cases arise where the logical and visual durations differ, it may be necessary to add a dur.vis attribute. Please note that the dur attribute is not a true duration, but rather a time stamp for the end point of the directive.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

endho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

endto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, optional
captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

startto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Major structural division of text, such as a preface, chapter or section. Often, the <head> sub-element identifies the <div>'s purpose.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: blockquote, div, head, lb, lg, list, p, pb, table

list.item:
facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: This element provides an alternative to the dots attribute on chord, note, rest, space, tuplet, and tupletspan elements. It should be used when specific display info, such as size or color, needs to be recorded for the dot. This element may also be used for dots of division in the mensural repertoire.

list.item:
color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

form, TOKEN, optional
records the function of the dot;
                that is, whether it is a dot of augmentation or a dot of
                division.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

loc, data.STAFFLOC, optional
encodes the staff location of the dot.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Indication of the volume of a note, phrase, or section of music. This element may be used for instantaneous or continuous textual dynamics, e.g. 'p', 'mf', or 'cresc. poco a poco'. The <hairpin> element should be used for graphical, i.e., crescendo and diminuendo, dynamic markings. The starting point of the dynamic marking may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges or endid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, bibl, choice, corpname, corr, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, name, num, orig, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, title, unclear

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dur, data.MEASUREBEAT, optional
encodes the logical and visual durations of the dynamic symbol or text. If cases arise where the logical and visual durations differ, it may be necessary to add a dur.vis attribute. Please note that the dur attribute is not a true duration, but rather a time stamp for the end point of the dynamic mark.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

endho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

endto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, optional
captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

startto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

value, data.MIDIVALUE, optional
captures a numeric value associated with the graphical dynamic sign.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A word or text phrase that indicates a difference in either content or form between the item being described and a related item previously issued by the same publisher/distributor (e.g. 2nd edition, version 2.0, etc.), or simultaneously issued by either the same publisher/distributor or another publisher/distributor (e.g. large print edition, British edition, etc.).

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Container for meta-data pertaining to a particular edition of the material being described.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Used to provide details of editorial principles and practices applied during the encoding of musical text.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: correction, interpretation, normalization, p, segmentation, stdvals

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Documents the relationship between an electronic file and the source or sources from which it was derived as well as applications used in the encoding/editing process.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Alternative ending for a repeated section of music. The scoredef element is allowed as a sub-element so that an ending may have its own meta-data without the overhead of child <section>s. Div sub-elements are not allowed within ending in order to avoid collisions with the brackets that are usually displayed over endings. Endings may *not* contain other ending elements.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: add, anchoredtext, annot, app, choice, corr, curve, damage, del, div, ending, expansion, gap, handshift, line, measure, orig, pb, reg, restore, sb, scoredef, section, sic, staff, staffdef, staffgrp, subst, supplied, symbol, unclear

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

entityref, ENTITY, optional
uses a previously-declared entity to identify an external electronic object.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fragment, data.FRAGMENT, optional
permits identification of one or more sub-parts within the object being pointed to.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
contains an ID reference for each of the participants in a collection of elements.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
title, TEXT, optional

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

xlink:actuate, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:href, data.URI, optional
allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

xlink:role, ANYURI, optional
indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A record of public exhibitions, including dates, venues, etc.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains the expansion of an abbreviation. The type attribute may be used to classify the abbreviation according to some convenient typology. This element is the mirror image of <abbr>. Both allow the encoder to transcribe both an abbreviation and its expansion. In <abbr>, however, the original is transcribed as the content of the element and the expansion as an attribute value; <expan> reverses this. The choice between the two elements is up to the user. If appropriate, the encoder may expand abbreviations in the source text silently, without tagging them. If this is done, the MEI header should indicate this has been done. The abbr attribute gives the abbreviation in its unexpanded form. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the expansion of the abbreviation. The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor or transcriber responsible for supplying the expansion of the abbreviation held as the content of the <expan> element.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, annot, bibl, choice, corpname, corr, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, name, num, orig, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, title, unclear

list.item:
abbr, TEXT, optional
captures the abbreviated form of the text.

cert, data.CERTAINTY, optional
signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.

evidence, NMTOKEN, optional
indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation. Suggested values include: 'internal', 'external', 'conjecture'.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

hand, IDREF, optional
signifies the hand of the agent which made the intervention. Its value must be the ID of a <hand> element declared in the header.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

resp, IDREFS, optional
records the editor(s) responsible for asserting a particular reading in a witness. Its value must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

seq, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
used to assign a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Indicates how a section may be programmatically expanded into its 'through-composed' form. See Read, p. 229 (ex. 12-16).

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

plist, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of ids of child <section>, <ending> or <app> elements.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Used to express size in terms other than physical dimensions, such as number of pages, number of records in file, number of bytes, performance duration for music, audio recordings and visual projections, etc. Use the <dimensions> element when it is necessary to specify the physical size of materials being described, for example, height and width.

unit, TEXT, optional
indicates the unit of measurement of the extent.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An empty linking element that uses attributes to connect the MEI document to an external electronic object. Either the entityref or href attribute may be used to identify the external object. Don't confuse this element with the <ptr< element, which is an internal link for movement from one place in the MEI document to another in the same document.

list.item:
entityref, ENTITY, optional
uses a previously-declared entity to identify an external electronic object.

fragment, data.FRAGMENT, optional
permits identification of one or more sub-parts within the object being pointed to.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

mimetype, TEXT, optional
specifies the applicable MIME (multimedia internet mail extension) type. The value should be a valid MIME media type defined by the Internet Engineering Task Force in RFC 2046.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional

title, TEXT, optional

defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:href, data.URI, optional
allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:

Either the entityref or href attribute may be used to identify the external object. Don't confuse this element with the <ref> element, which is an internal link for movement from one place in the MEI document to another in the same document.

div.p: Contains a representation of some written source in the form of a set of images rather than as transcribed or encoded text. The source attribute may be used to link the collection of images with a particular source described in the header.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A hold or pause. The <fermata> element is a specialized form of, i.e., syntactic sugar for, dir/@type="fermata" with &ferm; or &uferm; as its PCDATA content. The starting point of the fermata may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

facs, IDREFS, optional

form, TOKEN, optional

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
