indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: The mdiv element may contain one or both of 2 possible views of the music. The score view is the traditional full and open score while the parts view contains each performer's view of the score; that is, his part. These 2 views are necessary because it is not always possible or desirable to generate one from the other. The score and parts elements are placed here and not directly within the body element because score and part characteristics may change from mdiv to mdiv. For example, the 2nd movement of a symphony may require different performing forces (and therefore different score and part layout) than the other movements. The mdiv element may be recursively nested in order to represent music which exhibits this kind of structure. For example, an opera is normally divided into acts, which are in turn divided into scenes. This may be represented by the following markup: <mdiv> <- the opera <mdiv> <- act I <mdiv> <- scene i <mdiv> <- scene ii </mdiv> <mdiv> <- act II <mdiv> <- scene i <mdiv> <- scene ii </mdiv> </mdiv>

list.item:
facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: "In Western notation a vertical line drawn through the staff to mark off metrical units. Hence also the metrical unit thus indicated, which in American usage is called 'measure'. English usage often relies on context alone to make the distinction clear (e.g. 'up to the double bar', 'the end of the bar'), but 'bar-line' is also common." (New Grove) In MEI, the measure element is also a linking element that uses attributes to connect the MEI document to an external electronic object or to another location within the MEI instance.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: add, anchoredtext, annot, app, arpeg, beamspan, breath, choice, corr, curve, damage, del, dir, div, dynam, fermata, gap, hairpin, handshift, harm, harppedal, line, lyrics, midi, mordent, octave, orig, ossia, pb, pedal, phrase, reg, reh, restore, sb, scoredef, sic, slur, staff, staffdef, staffgrp, subst, supplied, symbol, tempo, tie, trill, tupletspan, turn, unclear

list.item:
barplace, data.BARPLACE, optional
describes the placement of the right barline.

complete, TOKEN, optional
allows the encoding of whether a measure matches the prevailing meter: a value of 'c' indicates a metrically complete measure, 'i' indicates a measure with not enough beats, while 'o' is for measures with too many beats.

control, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates whether or not the right barline is "controlling", that is, indicates a point of alignment across all the parts. Barlines within a score are usually 'controlling'; that is, they 'line up'. Barlines within a part may or may not be 'controlling' with respect to other parts.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

entityref, ENTITY, optional
uses a previously-declared entity to identify an external electronic object.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fragment, data.FRAGMENT, optional
permits identification of one or more sub-parts within the object being pointed to.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

join, IDREF, optional
indicates a measure which metrically completes the current one.

left, data.BARRENDITION, optional
indicates the visual rendition of the left barline. It is present here only for facilitation of translation from legacy encodings which use it. Usually, it can be safely ignored.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
contains an ID reference for each of the participants in a collection of elements.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

right, data.BARRENDITION, optional
indicates the function of the right barline and is structurally important.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

taktplace, data.STAFFLOC, optional
If takt barlines are to be used, then the taktplace attribute may be used to denote the staff location of the shortened barline. The location may include staff lines, spaces, and the spaces directly above and below the staff. The value ranges between 0 (just below the staff) to 2 * number of staff lines (directly above the staff). For example, on a 5-line staff the lines would be numbered 1,3,5,7, and 9 while the spaces would be numbered 0,2,4,6,8,10. For example, a value of '9' puts the barline through the top line of a 5-line staff.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
title, TEXT, optional

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
used to record the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the file.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
holds the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

width, data.NUMBER, optional
For rendering purposes, some music data systems rely on measure width data. The width attribute allows for the capture of this data in MEI for output back to these systems.

xlink:actuate, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:href, data.URI, optional
allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

xlink:role, ANYURI, optional
indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:
div.p: The document element for a single document, containing a header and data. The <mei> element defines a particular instance of a document encoded with the MEI schema. The name of this element should not be changed in order to assure an absolute minimum level of MEI compliance.

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

version, meiVersion, optional
names the version of the schema used by the instance.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A wrapper for general bibliographic and descriptive information about the encoded file. This information is often essential in a machine-readable environment. Five sub-elements must be encoded in the following order: <altmeiid>(optional), <filedesc>(required), <encodingdesc>(optional), <profiledesc;>(optional), and <revisiondesc>(optional). These elements and their sub-elements provide: a unique identifier for the MEI file, bibliographic information about the MEI file and its sources, information about the encoding process, information about the creation of the work being encoded, and statements regarding significant revisions of the file.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

type, TOKEN, optional
specifies the kind of document to which the header is attached, that is, whether it is a corpus or an individual text.
version, meiVersion, optional

div.head: Description:
div.p: The <mensur> element is provided for the encoding of mensural notation. It collects information about the metrical relationship between a note value and the next smaller value.

list.item:
color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dot, data.BOOLEAN, optional
specifies whether a dot is to be added to the base symbol.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

form, TOKEN, optional
indicates whether the base symbol is written vertically or horizontally.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

loc, data.STAFFLOC, optional
holds the staff location of the mensuration sign.

modusmaior, data.MODUSMAIOR, optional
describes the maxima-long relationship.

modusminor, data.MODUSMINOR, optional
describes the long-breve relationship.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

numbase, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

orient, data.ORIENTATION, optional
describes the rotation or reflection of the base symbol.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prolatio, data.PROLATIO, optional
describes the semibreve-minim relationship.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

sign, data.MENSURATIONSIGN, optional
the base symbol in the mensuration sign/time signature of mensural notation.

size, data.SIZE, optional
describes the relative size of the mensuration sign.

slash, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
indicates the number lines added to the mensuration sign. For example, one slash is added for what we now call 'alla breve'.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tempus, data.TEMPUS, optional
describes the breve-semibreve relationship.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff to which the MIDI event applies.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the MIDI event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Container for elements that contain information useful when generating MIDI output. The n attribute can be used to differentiate between multiple MIDI data streams, e.g. quantized/unquantized, straight/swing, ornamented/as notated, etc.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: cc, chan, chanpr, cue, hex, marker, metatext, noteoff, noteon, port, prog, seqnum, trkname, vel

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
describes the layer to which the <midi> element's children apply.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
describes the staff to which the <midi> element's children apply.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An ornament indicating rapid alternation of the main note with a secondary note, usually a step below, but sometimes a step above. See Read, p. 245-246. Events may be contained within <mordent> in order to record precise performance data. The starting point of the mordent may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: barline, beam, beatrpt, bend, btrem, chord, clefchange, custos, ftrem, gliss, halfmrpt, keysig, ligature, mensur, note, pad, proport, rest, space, tuplet

list.item:
accidlower, data.ACCIDENTAL.EXPLICIT, optional
records the written accidental associated with the lower neighboring note.

accidupper, data.ACCIDENTAL.EXPLICIT, optional
records the written accidental associated with the upper neighboring note.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

form, TOKEN, optional
'norm' signals the normal form, that is, the written note, followed by its lower neighbor, with a return to the written note, while 'inv' indicates the inverted form, that is, the principal note, followed by its upper neighbor, with a return to the principal note. Traditionally, the 'normal' mordent is written as a short wavy line with a vertical line through it and the inverted mordent is written without the vertical line. However, the meaning of these signs is sometimes reversed. See Read, p. 245-246. Another attribute in the visual domain would be necessary in order to be completely explicit about which visual symbol is actually to be rendered.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

long, data.BOOLEAN, optional
When the long attribute is set to 'yes', a double or long mordent, consisting of 5 notes, is indicated.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, optional
captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Complete measure rest in any meter (Read, p. 97-98). The numbering of consecutive measures of rest may be controlled via the multi.number attribute on the scoredef or staffdef elements.

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

cutout, TOKEN, optional
When set to 'rest' the cutout attribute indicates that the staff lines are to be displayed but not the rest itself. When set to 'staff' even the staff lines should not be drawn for this measure.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

dur.vis, data.DURATION, optional
records the durational symbol used in the source.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fermata, data.PLACE, optional
indicates the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a <fermata> element should be employed.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

instr, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

size, data.SIZE, optional
describes the relative size of the measure rest symbol.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An indication that the previous measure should be repeated. The automated numbering of consecutive measures of rest may be controlled via the multi.number attribute on the scoredef or staffdef elements.

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:

div.head: Description:

records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Multiple measures of rest compressed into a single symbol, frequently found in performer parts.

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

block, data.BOOLEAN, optional
When the block attribute is used, combinations of the 1, 2, and 4 measure rest forms (Read, p. 104) should be rendered instead of the modern form or the alternative symbol.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

instr, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
indicates the number of measures of rest.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Multiple repeated measures. In modern practice repeats of more than 2 measures should be written out using repeat signs. This element, however, is provided for handling non-standard practices often found in manuscript.

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

expand, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates whether or not to render the source measures instead of the repeat marking.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
indicates the number of measures to be repeated.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Container for everything else in the document apart from the header.

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.
version, meiVersion, optional

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains the name of an entity that is difficult to tag more specifically as a <corpname>, <geogname>, <persname>, or <title>. The <name> element may be used in place of the more specific elements when it is not known what kind of name is being described or when a high degree of precision is not necessary. For example, the <name> element might be used when it is not clear whether the name "Bach" refers to a person or a geographic feature. The <name> element may be used for an individual, such as 'Henry VIII, King of England'; a corporate body, such as 'The Beatles'; a geographical place; or a generative mechanical process. When name parts are needed, use <name> sub-elements. The recommended values for the type attribute are: pers, corp, place, process. The <date> sub-element is available within <name> in order to record any dates, associated with the name, i.e., birth and death in the case of persons or creation and dissolution in the case of a corporate entity or place.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, annot, bibl, choice, corpname, corr, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, name, num, orig, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, title, unclear

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

authority, TEXT, optional
contains the name of the list from which a controlled value is taken, such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names (TGN), etc.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

key, NMTOKEN, optional
used to record a value which serves as a primary key in an external database.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

reg, TEXT, optional
used to record a regularized form of the name.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Indicates the extent of normalization or regularization of the original source carried out in converting it to electronic form.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

method, TOKEN, optional
documents the method used to mark normalized passages.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A single pitched event. (Read, p. 63) The note element is allowed to contain other events for situations where a single written note may be representative of a group of performed notes. The accid and artic sub-elements may be used instead of the note element's attributes when accid and artic represent first-class objects, e.g., when they require attributes, such as x and y location attributes. Similarly, the syl sub-element may be used instead of the syl attribute. The verse sub-element may be used to group text syllables by verse.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: accid, add, app, artic, barline, beam, beatrpt, bend, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corr, custos, damage, del, dot, ftrem, gap, gliss, halfmrpt, handshift, keysig, ligature, mensur, note, orig, pad, proport, reg, rest, restore, sic, space, subst, supplied, syl, tuplet, unclear, verse

div.head: Used by:
div.p: bend, btrem, chord, ftrem, gliss, model.eventLike

list.item:
accid, data.ACCIDENTAL.EXPLICIT, optional
captures a written accidental symbol.

accid.ges, data.ACCIDENTAL.IMPLICIT, optional
records the performed pitch inflection when it differs from the written accidental.

accid.ho, data.NUMBER, optional
records the distance between the accidental and the note it modifies.

altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

artic, data.ARTICULATIONS, optional
encodes the written articulation(s). Articulations are normally encoded in order from the notehead outward; that is, away from the stem. See additional notes at att.vis.note. Only articulations should be encoded in the artic attribute; fingerings should be encoded using the <dir> element.

artic.ges, data.ARTICULATIONS, optional
records performed articulation that differs from the written value.

beam, data.BEAMS, optional
indicates that this event is "under a beam".

beam.with, data.PLACE, optional
In the case of cross-staff beams, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

breaksec, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
presence of this attribute indicates that the secondary beam should be broken following this note/chord. The value of the attribute records the number of beams which should remain unbroken.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

coloration, TOKEN, optional
indicates inverse coloration; that is, the notehead is void when it would otherwise be filled and vice versa. Do not confuse this with visual color.

colored, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates this note is 'colored' in the mensural notation sense.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.
detune, TEXT, optional

dot.ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal offset of the augmentation dot from its "normal", programmatically determined position.

dot.vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical offset of the augmentation dot from its "normal", programmatically determined position.

dot.x, data.NUMBER, optional
records the absolute horizontal position of the augmentation dot.

dot.y, data.NUMBER, optional
records the absolute vertical position of the augmentation dot.

dots, data.AUGMENTDOT, optional
encodes the number of written dots of augmentation.

dur, data.DURATION, optional
encodes logical; that is, written, duration.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

enclose.accid, data.ENCLOSURE, optional
encodes the characters used to enclose the accidental when it has a cautionary or editorial function.

enclose.note, data.ENCLOSURE, optional
encodes the characters used to enclose the note when it has a cautionary or editorial function.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fermata, data.PLACE, optional
used to indicate the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a fermata <element> should be employed.

gliss, data.GLISSANDO, optional
indicates that this element participates in a glissando.

grace, data.GRACE, optional
marks this chord as a grace and records from which note/chord it should "steal" time.

grace.time, data.PERCENT, optional
records the amount of time to be "stolen" from a non-grace note/chord.

headshape, data.HEADSHAPE, optional
used to override the headshape normally used for the given duration.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

instr, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

lig, TOKEN, optional
indicates this element's participation in a ligature.

lv, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates the attachment of an l.v. (laissez vibrer) sign to this element.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. Num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

numbase, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with num, describes duration as a ratio. Num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

oct, data.OCTAVE, optional
captures written octave information.

oct.ges, data.OCTAVE, optional
records performed octave information that differs from the written value.

pname, data.PITCHNAME, optional
contains the written pitch name.

pname.ges, data.PITCHNAME.GES, optional
records pitch name information that differs from the written value.

pnum, data.PITCHNUMBER, optional
holds a pitch-to-number mapping, a base-40 or MIDI note number, for example.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

size, data.SIZE, optional
describes the relative size of the note.

slur, data.SLURS, optional
indicates that this element participates in a slur.

slur.dir, data.SLURDIRECTION, optional
indicates the direction of a slur.

slur.rend, TOKEN, optional
describes the rendering style for slurs.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

stem.dir, data.STEMDIRECTION, optional
describes the direction of a stem.

stem.len, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the stem length.

stem.mod, data.STEMMODIFIER, optional
encodes any stem "modifiers"; that is, symbols rendered on the stem, such as tremolo or Sprechstimme indicators.

stem.pos, data.STEMPOSITION, optional
records the position of the stem in relation to the notehead(s).

stem.with, data.PLACE, optional
contains an indication of which staff a note or chord that logically belongs to the current staff should be visually placed on.

stem.x, data.NUMBER, optional
records the x coordinate of the stem's attachment point.

stem.y, data.NUMBER, optional
records the y coordinate of the stem's attachment point.

syl, TEXT, optional
holds an associated sung text syllable.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tab.fret, data.FRETNUMBER, optional
records the fret at which a string should be stopped.

tab.string, data.STRINGNUMBER, optional
records which string is to be played.

tie, data.TIE, optional
indicates that this element participates in a tie. If visual information about the tie needs to be recorded, then a <tie> element should be employed.

tie.dir, data.TIEDIRECTION, optional
determines the direction of a tie.

tie.rend, TOKEN, optional
describes the rendering style of a tie.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

tuplet, data.TUPLETS, optional
indicates that this element participates in a tuplet.

visible, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates if a note should be displayed when the notation is rendered. A note with this attribute set to 'false' should also not be included in a sounded rendition.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.MIDIVALUE, required
records the note number.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff to which the MIDI event applies.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the MIDI event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.MIDIVALUE, required
records the note number.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff to which the MIDI event applies.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

encodes the onset time of the MIDI event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Groups bibliographic annotations, each of which provides descriptive information in addition to that recorded in other parts of the bibliographic description. These annotations are similar to "general notes" in traditional bibliographic descriptions.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Numeric information in any form occurring in text.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, annot, bibl, choice, corpname, corr, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, name, num, orig, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, title, unclear

list.item:
facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

unit, TEXT, optional
indicates the units of measurement of the numeric value.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Octave displacement. (Read, p. 45). The starting point of the octave displacement may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges or endid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify one starting and one ending type of attribute.

list.item:
coll, TOKEN, optional
encodes whether the octave displacement should be performed simultaneously with the written notes, i.e., 'colla ottava'. See Read, p. 47-48.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dis, data.OCTAVE.DIS, required
states the amount of displacement.

dur, data.MEASUREBEAT, optional
encodes the logical and visual duration of the octave displacement. If logical and visual duration differ, it may be necessary to add a dur.vis attribute. Please note that the dur attribute here is not a true duration, but rather a time stamp for the end point of the octave displacement. Note that the dur attribute is NOT REQUIRED because the octave displacement can be visually instantaneous.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

endho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

endto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, required
indicates direction of displacement and display location and therefore is REQUIRED.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

rend, data.LINERENDITION, optional
captures the appearance of the continuation line associated with the octave displacement.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

startto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains a reading which is marked as following the original, rather than being normalized or corrected. This element will often be combined with a regularized form within a choice element.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, accid, add, address, annot, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, bibl, breath, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corpname, corr, custos, damage, date, del, dir, dot, dynam, expan, extptr, extref, fermata, fig, ftrem, gap, geogname, gliss, hairpin, halfmrpt, handshift, harm, harppedal, identifier, ineume, keysig, layer, lb, ligature, lyrics, measure, mensur, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, name, note, num, octave, orig, pad, pb, pedal, periodname, persname, phrase, proport, ptr, ref, reg, reh, rend, repository, rest, restore, section, sic, slur, space, stack, staff, stylename, subst, supplied, tempo, tie, title, trill, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, unclear, uneume

list.item:
cert, data.CERTAINTY, optional
signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.

evidence, NMTOKEN, optional
indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation. Suggested values include: 'internal', 'external', 'conjecture'.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

resp, IDREFS, optional
records the editor(s) responsible for asserting a particular reading in a witness. Its value must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Indicates an alternative, usually simpler, version of a measure *present in the source being transcribed*. An ossia may be treated as a substitute for the measure, in which case it is rendered on the current staff, or it may be rendered in addition to the measure's contents, in which case it is rendered above the staff on a reduced-size staff.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: add, anchoredtext, annot, app, arpeg, beamspan, breath, choice, corr, curve, damage, del, dir, div, dynam, fermata, gap, hairpin, handshift, harm, harppedal, line, lyrics, midi, mordent, octave, orig, ossia, pb, pedal, phrase, reg, reh, restore, sb, scoredef, sic, slur, staff, staffdef, staffgrp, subst, supplied, symbol, tempo, tie, trill, tupletspan, turn, unclear

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: One or more text phrases that form a logical prose passage. A paragraph is usually typographically distinct: The text usually begins on a new line and the first letter of the content is often indented, enlarged, or both.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, annot, bibl, blockquote, choice, corpname, corr, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, list, name, num, orig, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, table, title, unclear

list.item:
facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An indication of extra visual space between notational elements.

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

num, data.NUMBER, required
captures the amount of horizontal space to be added, expressed in one-half inter-line staff distance units.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An alternative visual rendition of the score from a particular performer's point of view. Part elements are not used in the score to indicate voice leading. Next attributes on event elements should be used for this purpose. Part elements are useful for encoding individual parts when there is no score, such as early music part books, when the music has non-aligning barlines, when different layout, such as page turns, are needed for the score and parts, or for accommodating software that requires part-by-part encoding. When assembly of the parts into a score is desired and there are non-aligning barlines, barlines which indicate points of alignment across all the parts may be marked as 'controlling', while non-aligning ones may be marked as 'non-controlling'.

div.head: Description:
div.p: The n attribute records the page number in the source. It need not be an integer, e.g. 'iv', or 'p17-3'. The logical page number can be calculated by counting previous <pb> ancestor elements. When used in a score context, a page break implies an accompanying system break.

list.item:
entityref, ENTITY, optional
uses a previously-declared entity to identify an external electronic object.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fragment, data.FRAGMENT, optional
permits identification of one or more sub-parts within the object being pointed to.

func, TOKEN, optional
states the side of a leaf (as in a manuscript) on which the content following the <pb> element occurs.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
title, TEXT, optional

xlink:actuate, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:href, data.URI, optional
allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

xlink:role, ANYURI, optional
indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Piano pedal mark (Read, p. 317-318). The starting point of the pedal mark may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

list.item:
color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dir, TOKEN, required
records the position of the pedal.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, optional
captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

style, TOKEN, optional
When style is set to 'line', the pedal mark is rendered with a continuous line. When it's set to pedstar, a pedal down is rendered with "Ped.", a pedal up is rendered as "*", and a pedal "bounce" is rendered with "Ped. *". When set to altpedstar pedal up and down indications are the same as with pedstar but a bounce is rendered with "Ped." only.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A label that describes a period of time, such as 'Baroque' or '3rd Style period'.

div.head: May contain:

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

contains the name of the list from which a controlled value is taken, such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names (TGN), etc.

used to record a value which serves as a primary key in an external database.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

reg, TEXT, optional
used to record a regularized form of the name.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional

div.p: Designation for an individual, including any or all of that individual's forenames, surnames, honorific titles, and added names. May contain name parts in <persname> sub-elements.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains a brief prose description of the appearance or description of the content of a physical page. Best practice suggests the use of controlled vocabulary. Don't confuse this element with a figure caption. A caption is text primarily intended for display with an illustration. It may or may not function as a description of the illustration.

div.p: TEXT, anchoredtext, annot, blockquote, curve, extptr, extref, lg, line, list, p, ptr, ref, symbol, table

div.head: Description:
div.p: A running footer on the first page. This element is a specialized form of the fw element. Auto-generated page numbers may be indicated with a processing instruction. The pgheadN and pgfootN elements should *not* be used to encode textual notes/annotations.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A running header on the first page. This element is a specialized form of the fw element for capturing the table-formatted textual data that often appears on the first page of printed music. It may also be used for similarly formatted material in manuscripts. The pgheadN and pgfootN elements should *not* be used to encode textual notes/annotations. Auto-generated page numbers may be indicated with a processing instruction.

lang, TEXT, optional
