div.head: Description:
div.p: Historically, a phrase mark indicated a "unified melodic idea", while the term "slur" was used for two-note legato patterns. (Read, p. 265). Nowadays, however, "phrase" and "slur" are often used interchangably (Read, p. 265-266), since the visual rendition of the two concepts is the same. MEI provides two distinct elements so that those users wishing to maintain a distinction for historical reasons may do so. If the user does not want to maintain the distinction, then the more generic <slur> element should be employed. The starting point of the phrase may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges or endid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify one starting and one ending type of attribute. Either place, bulge, or bezier attributes may be used to record the curvature of the phrase.

list.item:
bezier, NMTOKENS, optional
records the placement of Bezier control points as a series of space-separated xy coordinates, eg. 19 45 -32 118.

bulge, NMTOKENS, optional
describes the curve as a set of distance values above or below an imaginary line connecting the endpoints of the curve. The bulge attribute must contain one or more values of type NUMBER.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dur, data.MEASUREBEAT, optional
encodes the logical and visual duration of the phrase mark. If logical and visual duration differ, it may be necessary to add a dur.vis attribute. Please note that the dur attribute here is not a true duration, but rather a time stamp for the end point of the phrase mark.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

endho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

endto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endvo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

join, IDREFS, optional
used for linking visually separate phrase marks, sometimes necessary due to system breaks, that form a single musical phrase. Record the IDs of the separately encoded phrase marks, excluding this one.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, optional
captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

rend, data.CURVERENDITION, optional
records the appearance of the phrase mark.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

startto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startvo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

x2, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional 2nd x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

y2, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional 2nd y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Container for information about the location, appearance, construction, or handling of physical materials, such as their dimension, quantity, color, style, and technique of creation. Dedicatory text and title page features may also be encoded here when they are not transcribed as part of the front or back matter; i.e., when they are considered to be meta-data rather than a transcription.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: condition, dimensions, exhibithist, extent, handlist, inscription, physloc, physmedium, provenance, repository, titlepage, treatmenthist, treatmentsched

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Location of the source within a repository, e.g., shelf mark or other locational information.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. div.head: Description:
div.p: Records the physical materials used in the source, such as ink and paper. All materials may be described in a single <physmedium> element or multiple elements may be used, one for each medium.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

authority, TEXT, optional
contains the name of the list from which a controlled value is taken.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: MIDI port. The num attribute must be in the range 0-127.

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.MIDIVALUE, required
records the port value.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the MIDI event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: The cost of access to a bibliographic item.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

unit, TEXT, optional
indicates the currency of the price.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A detailed description of the non-bibliographic aspects of the creation of a musical work, specifically the languages and sublanguages used, the situation in which it was produced, e.g. the participants, setting, reception history, etc. Do not confuse this with <filedesc>, which bundles bibliographic information about the creation of the MEI file.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: MIDI program change. The num attribute must be in the range 0-127.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Project-level meta-data describing the aim or purpose for which the electronic file was encoded, funding agencies, etc. together with any other relevant information concerning the process by which it was assembled or collected.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: The <proportion> element is provided for the encoding of mensural notation. It allows the description of note durations as arithmetic ratios. While mensuration refers to the normal relationships between note durations, proportion affects the relations of the note durations to the tactus.

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
Together, num and numbase specify the change as a ratio, e.g., 1:3. Num is for the first value in the ratio.

numbase, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
Together, num and numbase specify the change as a ratio, e.g., 1:3. Numbase is for the second value in the ratio.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: The record of ownership or custodianship of an item.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, list, name, num, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An empty internal linking element that uses attributes to provide for movement from one place in an MEI document to another place in the same document. Unlike the <ref> element, <ptr> cannot contain text or sub-elements to describe the referenced object. Don't confuse this element with <extptr> which is used to connect the MEI document to an external electronic object.

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
contains an ID reference for each of the participants in a collection of elements.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
title, TEXT, optional

xlink:actuate, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:role, ANYURI, optional
indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Container for information regarding the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item, including the publisher's name and address, the date of publication, and other relevant details. When an item is unpublished, use only the <unpub> sub-element.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: address, availability, date, geogname, identifier, respstmt, unpub

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Since a reading can be a multi-measure section, the scoredef element is allowed so that a reading may have its own meta-data without the overhead of child sections. The measure sub-element is declared in the meiBase DTD and the pb sub-element is declared in the meiShared DTD. The app sub-element is permitted in order to allow nested sub-variants.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, accid, add, address, anchoredtext, annot, app, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, bibl, blockquote, breath, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corpname, corr, curve, custos, damage, date, del, dir, div, dot, dynam, ending, expan, extptr, extref, fermata, fig, ftrem, gap, geogname, gliss, hairpin, halfmrpt, handshift, harm, harppedal, identifier, ineume, keysig, layer, lb, lg, ligature, line, list, lyrics, measure, mensur, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, name, note, num, octave, orig, ossia, p, pad, pb, pedal, periodname, persname, phrase, proport, ptr, ref, reg, reh, rend, repository, rest, restore, sb, scoredef, section, sic, slur, space, stack, staff, staffdef, staffgrp, stylename, subst, supplied, syl, syllable, symbol, table, tempo, tie, title, trill, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, unclear, uneume, verse

list.item:
cause, NMTOKEN, optional
classifies the cause for the variant reading, according to any appropriate typology of possible origins.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

entityref, ENTITY, optional
uses a previously-declared entity to identify an external electronic object.

expan, IDREFS, optional
contains an ordered list of IDs of descendant <section>, <ending> or <rdg> elements. This 'expansion list' indicates how the section should be expanded into its 'through-composed' form. For example, expan="A End1 A End2" indicates that the section labelled 'A' comes first, then the ending labelled 'End1', followed by the 'A' section again, and finally the ending labelled 'End2'.

fragment, data.FRAGMENT, optional
permits identification of one or more sub-parts within the object being pointed to.

hand, IDREF, optional
signifies the hand responsible for a particular reading in a witness. The value of hand should correspond to the ID of a <hand> element given elsewhere in the document.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
contains an ID reference for each of the participants in a collection of elements.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

resp, IDREFS, optional
The editor(s) responsible for asserting a particular reading in a witness may be recorded in the resp attribute. The value of resp must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

seq, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
provides an integer indicating the position of this reading in a sequence, when there is reason to presume a sequence of the variant readings.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
title, TEXT, optional

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

xlink:actuate, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:href, data.URI, optional
allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

xlink:role, ANYURI, optional
indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An internal linking element that provides for movement from one place in a MEI document to another point in the same document. Unlike the <ptr> element, <ref> may contain text and sub-elements to describe the destination. Don't confuse this element with <extref> which provides for linking to an electronic object that is external to the MEI document.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, annot, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
contains an ID reference for each of the participants in a collection of elements.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
title, TEXT, optional

xlink:actuate, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:role, ANYURI, optional
indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense. It is possible to identify the individual responsible for the regularization, and, using the choice and orig elements, to provide both original and regularized readings.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, accid, add, address, annot, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, bibl, breath, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corpname, corr, custos, damage, date, del, dir, dot, dynam, expan, extptr, extref, fermata, fig, ftrem, gap, geogname, gliss, hairpin, halfmrpt, handshift, harm, harppedal, identifier, ineume, keysig, layer, lb, ligature, lyrics, measure, mensur, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, name, note, num, octave, orig, pad, pb, pedal, periodname, persname, phrase, proport, ptr, ref, reg, reh, rend, repository, rest, restore, section, sic, slur, space, stack, staff, stylename, subst, supplied, tempo, tie, title, trill, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, unclear, uneume

list.item:
cert, data.CERTAINTY, optional
signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.

evidence, NMTOKEN, optional
indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation. Suggested values include: 'internal', 'external', 'conjecture'.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

resp, IDREFS, optional
records the editor(s) responsible for asserting a particular reading in a witness. Its value must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

div.head: Description:
div.p: In an orchestral score and its corresponding parts, a mark indicating a convenient point from which to resume rehearsal after a break. They may also be called rehearsal figures, or when numbers are used instead of letters, rehearsal numbers. See Read, p. 443. Reh uses a subset of model.textphraseLike.limited. If the entire rehearsal mark is boxed or circled, the enclose attribute is preferred over a rend sub-element.

list.item:
color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

enclose, TOKEN, optional
encodes the characters used to enclose the rehearsal mark.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fontfam, data.FONTFAMILY, optional
contains the name of a font-family.

fontname, data.FONTNAME, optional
records the name of the font.

fontsize, data.NUMBER, optional
indicates the size of the font in printers' points, i.e., 1/72ths of an inch.

fontstyle, data.FONTSTYLE, optional
records the style of the font, i.e, italic, oblique, or normal.

fontweight, data.FONTWEIGHT, optional
used to indicate bold type.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, optional
captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff to which the rehearsal mark applies.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in a sequence of events to which the rehearsal mark applies.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
used to record the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the file.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
used to record the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the file.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A formatting element indicating special visual rendering, e.g., bold or italicized, of a text word or phrase. When an entire element should be rendered in a special way, a style sheet function should be used instead of the <rend> element.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, add, address, annot, bibl, choice, corpname, corr, damage, date, del, expan, extptr, extref, fig, gap, geogname, handshift, identifier, lb, name, num, orig, pb, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, reg, rend, repository, restore, sic, stack, stylename, subst, supplied, title, unclear

list.item:
altrend, TEXT, optional
used to extend the values of the rend attribute. One or the other of the rend and altrend attributes is required.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

fontfam, data.FONTFAMILY, optional
contains the name of a font-family.

fontname, data.FONTNAME, optional
records the name of the font.

fontsize, data.NUMBER, optional
indicates the size of the font in printers' points, i.e., 1/72ths of an inch.

fontstyle, data.FONTSTYLE, optional
records the style of the font, i.e, italic, oblique, or normal.

fontweight, data.FONTWEIGHT, optional
used to indicate bold type.

halign, TOKEN, optional
specifies the horizontal alignment of the element content.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

rend, data.TEXTRENDITION, optional
captures the appearance of the text. One or the other of the rend and altrend attributes is required.

rotation, data.DEGREES, optional
A positive value for rotation rotates the text in a counter-clockwise fashion, while negative values produce clockwise rotation.

valign, TOKEN, optional
specifies the vertical alignment of the element content.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Institution or agency which holds a bibliographic item. Sub-units of the institution may be marked with nested <repository> elements.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

authority, TEXT, optional
contains the name of the list from which a controlled value is taken, such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names (TGN), etc.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

key, NMTOKEN, optional
used to record a value which serves as a primary key in an external database.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

reg, TEXT, optional
used to record a regularized form of the name.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility.

list.item:
authority, TEXT, optional
contains the name of the list from which a controlled value is taken.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Names one or more individuals, groups, or in rare cases, mechanical processes, responsible for creation or realization of the intellectual or artistic content.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A non-sounding event found in the source being transcribed (Read, p. 96-102). Do not confuse this element with the space element which is used as an aid for visual alignment.

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

beam, data.BEAMS, optional
indicates that this event is "under a beam".

beam.with, data.PLACE, optional
In the case of cross-staff beams, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

colored, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates this note is 'colored' in the mensural notation sense.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dot.ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal offset of the augmentation dot from its "normal", programmatically determined position.

dot.vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical offset of the augmentation dot from its "normal", programmatically determined position.

dot.x, data.NUMBER, optional
records the absolute horizontal position of the augmentation dot.

dot.y, data.NUMBER, optional
records the absolute vertical position of the augmentation dot.

dots, data.AUGMENTDOT, optional
encodes the number of written dots of augmentation.

dur, data.DURATION, optional
encodes logical; that is, written, duration.

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fermata, data.PLACE, optional
used to indicate the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a <fermata> element should be employed.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

instr, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

line, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
indicates the line upon which the rest stands. The value must be in the range between 1 and the number of lines on the staff.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

numbase, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

size, data.SIZE, optional
describes the relative size of the rest.

spaces, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
states how many spaces are covered by the rest.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

tuplet, data.TUPLET, optional
indicates that this element participates in a tuplet.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Indicates restoration of musical material to an earlier state by cancellation of an editorial or authorial marking or instruction. The desc (description) attribute gives a prose description of the means of restoration, 'stet' or 'strike-down', for example. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the identification of the hand of the restoration. The type attribute may be used to indicate the action cancelled by the restoration. The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the hand of the restoration. The hand attribute signifies the hand of the agent which made the restoration.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, accid, add, address, annot, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, bibl, breath, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corpname, corr, custos, damage, date, del, dir, dot, dynam, expan, extptr, extref, fermata, fig, ftrem, gap, geogname, gliss, hairpin, halfmrpt, handshift, harm, harppedal, identifier, ineume, keysig, layer, lb, ligature, lyrics, measure, mensur, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, name, note, num, octave, orig, pad, pb, pedal, periodname, persname, phrase, proport, ptr, ref, reg, reh, rend, repository, rest, restore, section, sic, slur, space, stack, staff, stylename, subst, supplied, tempo, tie, title, trill, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, unclear, uneume

list.item:
desc, TEXT, optional
provides a description of the means of restoration.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

hand, IDREF, optional
signifies the hand of the agent which made the intervention. Its value must be the ID of a <hand> element declared in the header.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

seq, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
used to assign a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Container for information about alterations that have been made to an MEI file. It is recommended that changes be recorded in reverse chronological order, with the most recent alteration first.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains a prose description of the rationale and methods used in sampling texts in the creation of a corpus or collection.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An empty formatting element that forces notation to begin on a new line. Do not confuse this element with the <lb> element, which performs a similar function for text.

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

rend, TOKEN, optional
indicates whether hash marks should be rendered between systems. See Read, p. 436, ex. 26-3.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Full score view of the mdiv. Since the measure element is optional, a score may consist entirely of pagebreaks, each of which points to a page image. Div elements are allowed preceding and following sections of music data in order to accommodate blocks of explanatory text.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: add, anchoredtext, annot, app, choice, corr, curve, damage, del, div, ending, gap, handshift, line, orig, pb, reg, restore, sb, scoredef, section, sic, staffdef, staffgrp, subst, supplied, symbol, unclear

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: chordtable, instrgrp, keysig, pgfoot1, pgfoot2, pghead1, pghead2, staffgrp, symboltable, timeline

list.item:
bar.place, data.BARPLACE, optional
describes the placement of barlines.

beam.group, TEXT, optional
provides an example of how beaming (including secondary beams) is to be performed. It can be used to set a default beaming pattern to be used when no beaming is indicated at the event level. beam.group must contain a comma-separated list of time values that add up to a measure, e.g., in 4/4 time '4,4,4,4' indicates each quarter note worth of shorter notes would be beamed together. Parentheses can be used to indicate sub-groupings of secondary beams. For example, '(4.,4.,4.)' in 9/8 meter indicates one outer beam per measure with secondary beams broken at each dotted quarter duration, while a measure of 16th notes in 4/4 with beam.group equal to '(4,4),(4,4)' will result in a primary beam covering all the notes and secondary beams each group of 4 notes. This beaming "directive" can be overridden by using <beam> elements. If neither <beam> elements or the beam.group attribute is used, then no beaming is rendered. Beaming can be 'turned off' by setting beam.group to an empty string.

beam.rend, TOKEN, optional
encodes whether a beam is feathered and in which direction.

beam.rests, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates whether beams should include rests shorter than a quarter note duration.

beam.slope, data.NUMBER, optional
captures default beam slope.

clef.color, data.COLOR, optional
describes the color of the clef.

clef.dis, data.OCTAVE.DIS, optional
records the amount of octave displacement to be applied to the clef.

clef.dis.place, data.PLACE, optional
records the direction of octave displacement to be applied to the clef.

clef.line, data.CLEFLINE, optional
contains a default value for the position of the clef.

clef.shape, data.CLEFSHAPE, optional
encodes a value for the clef symbol.

clef.visible, data.BOOLEAN, optional
determines whether the clef is to be displayed.

dur.default, data.DURATION, optional
used to determine the duration value of the first note in a layer if it has no dur attribute.

dynam.dist, data.NUMBER, optional
records the default distance from the staff of dynamic marks.

ending.rend, TOKEN, optional
describes where ending marks should be displayed.

grace, data.GRACE, optional
Setting the grace attribute here provides the possibility of changing all the grace attribute values in a score without having to individually change each event's grace attribute value. Each "graced" element may still require a value in its grace.time attribute.

grid.show, data.BOOLEAN, optional
determines whether to display guitar chord grids.

harm.dist, data.NUMBER, optional
records the default distance from the staff of harmonic indications, such as guitar chord grids or functional labels.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

key.accid, data.ACCIDENTAL.IMPLICIT, optional
contains an accidental for the tonic key, if one is required, e.g., if key.pname equals 'c' and key.accid equals 's', then a tonic of C# is indicated.

key.mode, data.MODE, optional
indicates major, minor, or other tonality.

key.pname, data.PITCHNAME, optional
holds the pitch name of the tonic key, e.g. 'c' for the key of C.

key.sig, data.KEYSIGNATURE, optional
indicates where the key lies in the circle of fifths.

key.sig.mixed, NMTOKEN, optional
Mixed key signatures, e.g. those consisting of a mixture of flats and sharps (Read, p. 143, ex. 9-39), and key signatures with unorthodox placement of the accidentals (Read, p. 141) must be indicated by setting the key.sig attribute to 'mixed' and providing explicit keysig info in the key.sig.mixed attribute or in the <keysig> element. It is intended that key.sig.mixed contain a series of tokens with each token containing pitch name, accidental, and octave, such as 'As4 Cs5 Ef5' that indicate what key accidentals should be rendered and where they should be placed.

key.sig.show, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates whether the key signature should be displayed.

key.sig.showchange, data.BOOLEAN, optional
determines whether cautionary accidentals should be displayed at a key change.

lyric.align, data.NUMBER, optional
describes the alignment of lyric syllables associated with a note or chord.

lyric.fam, data.FONTFAMILY, optional
sets the font family default value for lyrics.

lyric.name, data.FONTNAME, optional
sets the font name default value for lyrics.

lyric.size, data.NUMBER, optional
sets the default font size value for lyrics.

lyric.style, data.FONTSTYLE, optional
sets the default font style value for lyrics.

lyric.weight, data.FONTWEIGHT, optional
sets the default font weight value for lyrics.

mensur, data.MENSURATIONSIGN, optional
the base symbol in the mensuration sign/time signature of mensural notation.

mensur.dot, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates whether a dot is to be added to the base symbol.

mensur.form, TOKEN, optional
indicates whether the base symbol is written vertically or horizontally.

mensur.loc, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
holds the staff location of the mensuration sign.

mensur.orient, data.ORIENTATION, optional
describes the rotation or reflection of the base symbol.

mensur.size, data.SIZE, optional
describes the relative size of the mensuration sign.

mensur.slash, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
indicates the number lines added to the mensuration sign. For example, one slash is added for what we now call 'alla breve'.

meter.count, data.NUMBER, optional
captures the number of beats in a measure, that is, the top number of the meter signature.

meter.rend, TOKEN, optional
contains indication of how the meter signature should be rendered.

meter.sig.showchange, data.BOOLEAN, optional
determines whether a new meter signature should be displayed when the meter signature changes.

meter.sym, data.METERSIGN, optional
indicates the use of a meter symbol isntead of a numeric meter signature, that is, 'C' for common time or 'C' with a slash for cut time.

meter.unit, data.NUMBER, optional
contains the number indicating the beat unit, that is, the bottom number of the meter signature.

midi.channel, data.MIDICHANNEL, optional
sets the default MIDI channel.

midi.div, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
sets the number of MIDI ticks per quarter note.

midi.tempo, data.MIDITEMPO, optional
sets the default MIDI tempo.

mnum.visible, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates whether measure numbers should be displayed.

modusmaior, data.MODUSMAIOR, optional
describes the maxima-long relationship.

modusminor, data.MODUSMINOR, optional
describes the long-breve relationship.

multi.number, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates whether programmatically calculated counts of multiple measures of rest (mrest) and whole measure repeats (mrpt) in parts should be rendered.

music.name, data.MUSICFONT, optional
sets the default music font name.

music.size, data.NUMBER, optional
sets the default music font size.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

numbase, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

octave.default, data.OCTAVE, optional
functions similarly to dur.default. If the oct attribute isn't given on the first note of a measure, then the value of octave.default is used.

ontheline, data.BOOLEAN, optional
determines the placement of notes on a 1-line staff. A value of 'yes' places all notes on the line, while a value of 'no' places stems-up notes above the line and stems-down notes below the line.

optimize, data.BOOLEAN, optional
display only those staves with notes?

page.botmar, data.NUMBER, optional
indicates the amount of whitespace at the bottom of a rendered score page.

page.height, data.NUMBER, optional
describes the physical height of the rendered output page.

page.leftmar, data.NUMBER, optional
indicates the amount of whitespace at the left side of a rendered score page.

page.panels, data.PAGE.PANELS, optional
indicates the number of logical pages to be rendered on a single physical page.

page.rightmar, data.NUMBER, optional
indicates the amount of whitespace at the right side of a rendered score page.

page.scale, data.PGSCALE, optional
indicates how the page should be scaled when rendered.

page.topmar, data.NUMBER, optional
indicates the amount of whitespace at the top of a rendered score page.

page.units, data.PGUNITS, optional
contains the real-world measurement units (inches, centimeters, millimeters) used to describe the rendered page height and width.

page.width, data.NUMBER, optional
describes the physwical width of the rendered output page.

pedal.rend, TOKEN, optional
determines whether piano pedal marks should be drawn as lines or as terms (e.g. 'Ped.' for pedal down and '*' for pedal up).

prolatio, data.PROLATIO, optional
describes the semibreve-minim relationship.

proport.num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
Together, proport.num and proport.numbase specify a proportional change as a ratio, e.g., 1:3. Proport.num is for the first value in the ratio.

proport.numbase, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
Together, proport.num and proport.numbase specify a proportional change as a ratio, e.g., 1:3. Proport.numbase is for the second value in the ratio.

reh.enclose, TOKEN, optional
describes the enclosing shape for rehearsal marks.

slur.rend, data.CURVERENDITION, optional
describes the default rendering style for slurs.

spacing.packexp, data.NUMBER, optional
describes a note's spacing relative to its time value.

spacing.packfact, data.NUMBER, optional
describes the note spacing of output.

spacing.staff, data.NUMBER, optional
sets the minimum amount of space between staves in the same system.

spacing.system, TEXT, optional
contains a space-separated pair of numbers describing the minimum and maximum amount of space between systems.

system.leftmar, data.NUMBER, optional
describes the amount of whitespace at the left system margin relative to page.leftmar

system.rightmar, data.NUMBER, optional
describes the amount of whitespace at the right system margin relative to page.rightmar

system.topmar, data.NUMBER, optional
describes the distance from page's top edge to the first system; used for first page only

tempo, data.TEMPOVALUE, optional
records tempo in beats (meter signature denominator) per minute.

tempus, data.TEMPUS, optional
describes the breve-semibreve relationship.

text.dist, data.NUMBER, optional
determines how far from the staff to render text elements.

text.fam, data.FONTFAMILY, optional
sets the default font family value for text other than lyrics.

text.name, data.FONTNAME, optional
sets the default font name value for text other than lyrics.

text.size, data.NUMBER, optional
sets the default font size value for text other than lyrics.

text.style, data.FONTSTYLE, optional
sets the default font style value for text other than lyrics.

text.weight, data.FONTWEIGHT, optional
sets the default font weight value for text other than lyrics.

tie.rend, data.CURVERENDITION, optional
describes the default rendering style for ties.

trans.diat, data.NUMBER, optional
holds the amount of diatonic pitch shift, e.g. C to C# = 0, C to Db = 1. Transposition requires both trans.diat and trans.semi attributes in order to distinguish the difference, for example, between a transposition from C to C# and one from C to Db.

trans.semi, data.NUMBER, optional
contains the amount of pitch shift in semitones, C to C# = 1, C to Db = 1. Transposition requires both trans.diat and trans.semi attributes in order to distinguish the difference, for example, between a transposition from C to C# and one from C to Db.

tune.Hz, data.NUMBER, optional
holds a value for cycles per second, i.e., Hertz, for a tuning reference pitch.

tune.pname, data.PITCHNAME, optional
holds the pitch name, such as 'a', for a tuning reference pitch.

tune.temper, data.TEMPERAMENT, optional
provides a label for the tuning system, 'just', for example.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Container for actual music data. The linking attributes are available here so that this element can point to external media objects or to related internal elements, such as annotations.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: add, anchoredtext, annot, app, choice, corr, curve, damage, del, div, ending, expansion, gap, handshift, line, measure, orig, pb, reg, restore, sb, scoredef, section, sic, staff, staffdef, staffgrp, subst, supplied, symbol, unclear

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

entityref, ENTITY, optional
uses a previously-declared entity to identify an external electronic object.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fragment, data.FRAGMENT, optional
permits identification of one or more sub-parts within the object being pointed to.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
contains an ID reference for each of the participants in a collection of elements.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

restart, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates that staves begin again with this section.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

targettype, NMTOKEN, optional
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
title, TEXT, optional

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

xlink:actuate, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

xlink:href, data.URI, optional
allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

xlink:role, ANYURI, optional
indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

xlink:show, TOKEN, optional
defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Describes the principles according to which the musical text has been segmented, for example into movements, sections, etc.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: MIDI sequence number. The num attribute must be in the range 0-65535.

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, required
holds the MIDI sequence number.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff to which the MIDI event applies.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the MIDI event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Groups information about the series, if any, to which a publication belongs. In this context, the title element records the series title, the respStmt element records the person or group responsible for the series, and the identifier element contains a series identifier. The list element should be used when it is necessary to enumerate the contents of the series. The seriesstmt is provided within seriesstmt for the description of a sub-series.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains apparently incorrect or inaccurate musical material. A correction for the apparent error may be given in an accompanying child or sibling corr element.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, accid, add, address, annot, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, bibl, breath, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corpname, corr, custos, damage, date, del, dir, dot, dynam, expan, extptr, extref, fermata, fig, ftrem, gap, geogname, gliss, hairpin, halfmrpt, handshift, harm, harppedal, identifier, ineume, keysig, layer, lb, ligature, lyrics, measure, mensur, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, name, note, num, octave, orig, pad, pb, pedal, periodname, persname, phrase, proport, ptr, ref, reg, reh, rend, repository, rest, restore, section, sic, slur, space, stack, staff, stylename, subst, supplied, tempo, tie, title, trill, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, unclear, uneume

list.item:
facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Historically, the term "slur" indicated two notes performed legato, while the term "phrase" was used for a "unified melodic idea". Nowadays, however, "slur" often has the same meaning as "phrase" (See Read, p. 265-266), since the visual rendition of the two concepts is the same. MEI provides two distinct elements so that those users wishing to maintain a distinction for historical reasons may do so. If the user does not want to maintain the distinction, then the more generic <slur> element should be employed. The starting point of the slur may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges or endid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify one starting and one ending type of attribute. Either place, bulge, or bezier attributes may be used to record the curvature of the slur. The slur and tie elements may be used instead of the slur.* and tie.* attributes provided on chord and note elements when 1) they are required by software, or 2) multiple, alternative slurs are needed.

list.item:
bezier, NMTOKENS, optional
records the placement of Bezier control points as a series of space-separated xy coordinates, eg. 19 45 -32 118.

bulge, NMTOKENS, optional
describes the curve as a set of distance values above or below an imaginary line connecting the endpoints of the curve. The bulge attribute must contain one or more values of type NUMBER.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dur, data.MEASUREBEAT, optional
encodes the logical and visual duration of the slur. If logical and visual duration differ, it may be necessary to add a dur.vis attribute. Please note that the dur attribute is not a true duration, but rather a time stamp for the end point of the slur. Durations of longer than one measure may give the number of measures followed by the timestamp, e.g. "1m+3". Values within the current measure may be expressed as "0m+3" or as simply "3".

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

endho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

endto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

endvo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined end point.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

join, IDREFS, optional
used for linking visually separate slurs, sometimes necessary due to system breaks, that form a single musical phrase. Record the IDs of the separately encoded slurs, excluding this one.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, optional
captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

rend, data.CURVERENDITION, optional
records the appearance of the slur.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

startto, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

startvo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined start point.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
