used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff to which the MIDI event applies.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the MIDI event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A group of notes with "irregular" (sometimes called "irrational") rhythmic values, for example, three notes in the time normally occupied by two or nine in the time of five. The beam sub-element is allowed so that custom beaming may be indicated, i.e., a septuplet may be divided into a group of 3 plus a group of 4 notes. See Read, p. 187-215. The tuplet element may also used for bowed tremolo (Read, p. 394) and double, triple, or flutter tonguing (Read, p. 348-349); that is, for repetition of the same pitch.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: barline, beam, beatrpt, bend, btrem, chord, clefchange, custos, ftrem, gliss, halfmrpt, keysig, ligature, mensur, note, pad, proport, rest, space, tuplet

list.item:
bracket.place, data.PLACE, optional
used to state where the bracket will be placed in relation to the noteheads.

bracket.visible, data.BOOLEAN, optional
states whether a bracket should be rendered with the tuplet.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dots, data.AUGMENTDOT, optional
records the number of augmentation dots required by a dotted duration.

dur, restriction of list of data.DURATION, optional
captures the time taken up by the tuplet. Unlike other control events where the dur attribute is expressed as a time stamp, dur here is a true duration. If dur is omitted, the default is to calculate the total duration of the included notes and use the next shorter un-dotted value. Irrational durations, such as 2 quarter notes in the time of 5 8th notes in a measure of 5/8 time, may be expressed as a list of durations which are to be added together to form the total duration. In this case, the dur attribute could take the value "2 8" or "8 8 8 8 8".

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc. In the case of irrational durations, such as such as 2 quarter notes in the time of 5 8th notes in a measure of 5/8 time, decimal values may be used. In this case, the dur.ges attribute would take the value "2.5" if the midi.div attribute's value was "1".

dur.visible, data.BOOLEAN, optional
determines if the tuplet duration is visible.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second. These attributes may be used for explicit labelling of the tuplet, such as, '3' with an 8th-note triplet, '3:2' over a quarter-note triplet, etc. The rendering of the ratio, however, is dependent on the num.format attribute found in the att.vis.tuplet attribute class.

num.format, TOKEN, optional
controls how the num:numbase ratio is to be displayed. When set to 'count' only the num attribute is displayed, e.g., '7'; however, when set to 'ratio', both the num and numbase attributes are displayed, e.g., '7:4'.

num.place, data.PLACE, optional
states where the tuplet number will be placed in relation to the noteheads.

num.visible, data.BOOLEAN, optional
determines if the tuplet number is visible.

numbase, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

with, data.PLACE, optional
In the case of cross-staff tuplets, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Alternative element for encoding tuplets, especially useful for those which extend across barlines. The starting point of the tuplet may be indicated by either a tstamp, tstamp.ges, tstamp.real or startid attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges or endid attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify one starting and one ending type of attribute.

list.item:
bracket.place, data.PLACE, optional
used to state where the bracket will be placed in relation to the noteheads.

bracket.visible, data.BOOLEAN, optional
states whether a bracket should be rendered with the tuplet.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

dots, data.AUGMENTDOT, optional
records the number of augmentation dots required by a dotted duration.

dur, restriction of list of data.DURATION, optional
captures the time taken up by the tuplet. Unlike other control events where the dur attribute is expressed as a time stamp, dur here is a true duration. If dur is omitted, the default is to calculate the total duration of the included notes and use the next shorter un-dotted value. Irrational durations, such as 2 quarter notes in the time of 5 8th notes in a measure of 5/8 time, may be expressed as a list of durations which are to be added together to form the total duration. In this case, the dur attribute could take the value "2 8" or "8 8 8 8 8".

dur.ges, TEXT, optional
records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

dur.visible, data.BOOLEAN, optional
determines if the tuplet duration is visible.

endid, IDREF, optional
indicates the final element in the sequence.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

num.format, TOKEN, optional
controls how the num:numbase ratio is to be displayed. When set to 'count' only the num attribute is displayed, e.g., '7'; however, when set to 'ratio', both the num and numbase attributes are displayed, e.g., '7:4'.

num.place, data.PLACE, optional
states where the tuplet number will be placed in relation to the noteheads.

num.visible, data.BOOLEAN, optional
determines if the tuplet number is visible.

numbase, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

with, data.PLACE, optional
In the case of cross-staff tuplets, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

div.head: Description:
div.p: An ornament consisting of four notes — the upper neighbor of the written note, the written note, the lower neighbor, and the written note. See Read, p. 246-247. Events may be contained within <turn> in order to record precise performance data. Whether the turn is accented or unaccented may be inferred from the timestamp — accented turns occur directly on the affected beat, unaccented ones do not.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: barline, beam, beatrpt, bend, btrem, chord, clefchange, custos, ftrem, gliss, halfmrpt, keysig, ligature, mensur, note, pad, proport, rest, space, tuplet

list.item:
accidlower, data.ACCIDENTAL.EXPLICIT, optional
records the accidental associated with the lower neighboring note.

accidupper, data.ACCIDENTAL.EXPLICIT, optional
records the accidental associated with the upper neighboring note.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

delayed, data.BOOLEAN, optional
When the delayed attribute is set to 'yes', the turn begins on the second half of the beat. See Read, p. 246.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

form, TOKEN, optional
indicates whether the turn begins on the note above (norm) or on the note below (inv).

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

place, data.PLACE, optional
captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

plist, data.PLIST, optional
may contain ID references or xPointer fragment identifiers that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, restriction of list of data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, required
signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

startid, IDREF, optional
holds a reference to the element to which the turn is attached.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., HH:MM:SS.ss, since the beginning of the file.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Contains musical material which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source. Where the difficulty in transcription arises from an identifiable cause, the agent attribute signifies the causative agent. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the transcription of the text contained within the <unclear> element. Where the difficulty in transcription arises from action (partial deletion, etc.) assignable to an identifiable hand, the hand attribute signifies the hand responsible for the action. The reason attribute indicates why the material is difficult to transcribe. The resp attribute indicates the individual responsible for the transcription of the word, phrase, or passage contained with the <unclear> element.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, accid, add, address, annot, arpeg, artic, barline, beam, beamspan, beatrpt, bend, bibl, breath, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corpname, corr, custos, damage, date, del, dir, dot, dynam, expan, extptr, extref, fermata, fig, ftrem, gap, geogname, gliss, hairpin, halfmrpt, handshift, harm, harppedal, identifier, ineume, keysig, layer, lb, ligature, lyrics, measure, mensur, midi, mordent, mrest, mrpt, mrpt2, mspace, multirest, multirpt, name, note, num, octave, orig, pad, pb, pedal, periodname, persname, phrase, proport, ptr, ref, reg, reh, rend, repository, rest, restore, section, sic, slur, space, stack, staff, stylename, subst, supplied, tempo, tie, title, trill, tuplet, tupletspan, turn, unclear, uneume

list.item:
agent, TEXT, optional
indicates the causative agent of the illegible text.

cert, data.CERTAINTY, optional
signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.

evidence, NMTOKEN, optional
indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation. Suggested values include: 'internal', 'external', 'conjecture'.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

hand, IDREF, optional
Where the difficulty in transcription arises from action (partial deletion, etc.) assignable to an identifiable hand, signifies the hand responsible for the action.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

reason, TEXT, optional
indicates why the material is difficult to transcribe.

resp, IDREFS, optional
records the editor(s) responsible for asserting a particular reading in a witness. Its value must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

source, IDREFS, optional
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

div.head: Description:
div.p: A graphically uninterrupted neume sign. While ineume is allowed as a sub-element of uneume here as part of the model.eventLike.neume class, it is unlikely that an uninterrupted neume containing an interrupted neume is a meaningful construct.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: add, app, barline, beam, beatrpt, bend, btrem, choice, chord, clefchange, corr, custos, damage, del, ftrem, gap, gliss, halfmrpt, handshift, keysig, ligature, mensur, note, orig, pad, proport, reg, rest, restore, sic, space, subst, supplied, tuplet, unclear, verse

list.item:
altsym, IDREF, optional
provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symboldef> element elsewhere in the document.

color, data.COLOR, optional
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

form, data.UNEUMEFORM, optional
records the function of the neume.

hfunc, TEXT, optional
contains an indication of the harmonic function of this neume.

ho, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

inth, TEXT, optional
encodes the harmonic interval from a pitch occuring at the same time.

intm, TEXT, optional
encodes the melodic interval from the previous neume.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer within which the event is active.

mfunc, TEXT, optional
contains an indication of the melodic function of this element.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

name, data.UNEUMENAME, optional
records the name of the neume.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

pclass, data.PITCHCLASS, optional
holds pitch class information.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

psolfa, TEXT, optional
contains solfa designation, e.g., do, re, mi, etc., in either fixed or movable Do systems.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

size, data.SIZE, optional
encodes the relative size of the neume.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff within which the event is active.

subtype, NMTOKEN, optional
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

syl, TEXT, optional
holds an associated sung text syllable.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

tstamp.ges, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

tstamp.real, data.ISOTIME, optional
records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

type, NMTOKEN, optional
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

visible, data.BOOLEAN, optional
indicates if a neume should be displayed when the notation is rendered. A neume with this attribute set to 'false' should also not be included in a sounded rendition.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Used to explicitly indicate that a bibliographic source is unpublished.

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Container for information about the conditions that affect use of a bibliographic item after access has been granted. May indicate limitations imposed by an owner, repository, or legal statute (for example, copyright law) regarding the reproduction, publication, or quotation of the item. May also indicate the absence of restrictions, such as when rights have been ceded to the public domain. Do not confuse with the <accessdesc> element, which holds information about conditions affecting the availability of the material.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: TEXT, abbr, address, bibl, corpname, date, expan, extptr, extref, fig, geogname, identifier, lb, name, num, periodname, persname, ptr, ref, rend, repository, stack, stylename, title

list.item:
analog, TEXT, optional
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which an MEI element is comparable. Mapping elements from one system to another may help a repository harvest selected data from the MEI file to build a basic catalog record. The encoding system from which fields are taken must be specified. When possible, subfields as well as fields should be specified, e.g., subfields within MARC fields.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: Description:
div.p: MIDI Note-on/off velocity. The num attribute must be in the range 1-127.

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

form, TOKEN, required
indicates whether this is note-on or note-off velocity data.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

layer, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

num, data.MIDIVALUE, required
records the velocity value.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

staff, data.INTEGERPOSITIVE, optional
signifies the staff to which the MIDI event applies.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

tstamp, data.BEAT, optional
encodes the onset time of the MIDI event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Lyric verse. The lb element is allowed here in order to facilitate karaoke applications. The func attribute on lb may be used to distinguish true line ends from line group ends for these applications.

div.head: May contain:
div.p: dir, dynam, lb, space, syl, tempo

list.item:
copyof, IDREF, optional
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

corresp, IDREFS, optional
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.

facs, IDREFS, optional
permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

fontfam, data.FONTFAMILY, optional
contains the name of a font-family.

fontname, data.FONTNAME, optional
records the name of the font.

fontsize, data.NUMBER, optional
indicates the size of the font in printers' points, i.e., 1/72ths of an inch.

fontstyle, data.FONTSTYLE, optional
records the style of the font, i.e, italic, oblique, or normal.

fontweight, data.FONTWEIGHT, optional
used to indicate bold type.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lang, TEXT, optional
identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

next, IDREFS, optional
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

prev, IDREFS, optional
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

refrain, data.BOOLEAN, optional
used to indicate a common, usually centered, refrain (Mup User's Guide, p. 44).

rhythm, TEXT, optional
used to specify a rhythm for the lyrics that differs from that of the notes on the staff.

sameas, IDREFS, optional
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

synch, IDREFS, optional
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

to, data.TSTAMPOFFSET, optional
records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

vo, data.VISUALOFFSET, optional
records the vertical adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

when, IDREF, optional
indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

x, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional x coordinate.

y, data.NUMBER, optional
encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Indicates a point in time either absolutely (using the absolute attribute), or relative to other elements in the same timeline element (using the interval and since attributes).

list.item:
absolute, TEXT, optional
provides an absolute value for the time associated with this point. This attribute is required for the element designated as the origin by the parent timeline.

data, IDREFS, optional
used to link this point in time to a particular data element, i.e., mdiv, part, section, ending, reading, measure, staff or layer, when there are multiple sources.

id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

interval, data.NUMBERPOSITIVE, optional
specifies the (positive) numeric portion of a time interval.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

since, IDREF, optional
identifies the reference point for determining the time of the current when element, which is obtained by adding the interval to the time of the reference point. The value should be the ID of another when element in the same timeline. If the since attribute is omitted, and the absolute attribute is not specified, then then reference point is understood to be the preceding when element.

unit, NMTOKEN, optional
specifies the unit of time in which the interval value is expressed, if this is not inherited from the parent timeline.

div.head: Description:
div.p: Defines a rectangular area contained within a surface.

list.item:
id, ID, optional
regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

lrx, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
indicates the lower-right corner x coordinate.

lry, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
indicates the lower-left corner x coordinate.

n, NMTOKEN, optional
provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

ulx, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
indicates the upper-left corner x coordinate.

uly, data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE, optional
indicates the upper-left corner y coordinate.

div.head: data.ACCIDENTAL.EXPLICIT
div.p: Description: Accidental attribute values: s = sharp, f = flat, ss = dblsharp, x=dblsharp, ff = dblflat, xs = triple sharp, tb = triple flat, n = natural, nf = naturalflat, ns = naturalsharp. ss indicates the use of 2 sharp signs, while x indicates the use of a single double sharp. nf and ns are used to cancel dbflats and dblsharps, respectively. su = sharp note qtr. tone up, sd = sharp note qtr. tone down, fu = flat note qtr. tone up, fd = flat note qtr. tone down, nu = natural note qtr. tone up, nd = natural note quarter tone down. Quarter-tone accidentals listed in Read, p. 145.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: s
f
ss
x
ff
xs
tb
n
nf
ns
su
sd
fu
fd
nu
nd

div.head: data.ACCIDENTAL.IMPLICIT
div.p: Description: Accidental attribute values: s = sharp, f = flat, ss = dblsharp, x=dblsharp, ff = dblflat, xs = triple sharp, tb = triple flat, n = natural, nf = naturalflat, ns = naturalsharp. ss indicates the use of 2 sharp signs, while x indicates the use of a single double sharp. nf and ns are used to cancel dbflats and dblsharps, respectively. su = sharp note qtr. tone up, sd = sharp note qtr. tone down, fu = flat note qtr. tone up, fd = flat note qtr. tone down, nu = natural note qtr. tone up, nd = natural note quarter tone down. Quarter-tone accidentals listed in Read, p. 145.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: s
f
ss
ff
n

div.head: data.ARTICULATION
div.p: Description: The following list of articulations mostly corresponds to symbols 1D110-1D111, 1D17B-1D182, 1D185-1D189, 1D1AA-1D1AD, 1D1B3-1D1B5 from the Western Musical Symbols portion of the Unicode Standard, v. 3.1. The dot and stroke values may be used in cases where interpretation is not desirable.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: acc
stacc
ten
stacciss
marc
marc-stacc
acc-marc
loure
spicc
rip
doit
plop
fall
bend
flip
smear
dnbow
upbow
harm
snap
fingernail
damp
dampall
open
stop
dbltongue
trpltongue
heel
toe
tap
pluck
dot
stroke

div.head: data.ARTICULATIONS
div.p: Description: One or more values from the list given in the definition of data.ARTICULATION.

div.head: data.AUGMENTDOT
div.p: Description: Dots attribute values (number of augmentation dots) (Read, 113-119, ex. 8-21)

list.head: restriction of xs:nonNegativeInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 4

div.head: data.BARPLACE
div.p: Description: Placement of barlines: 'mensur' = between staves only, 'staff' = between and across staves as necessary, 'takt' = short line above staff or through top line. The default value is 'staff'.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: mensur
staff
takt

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: dashed
dotted
dbl
dbldashed
dbldotted
end
invis
rptstart
rptboth
rptend
single

div.head: data.BEAM
div.p: Description: Beam attribute values: initial, medial, terminal. Nested beaming is permitted.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pattern "[i|m|t][1-6]"

div.head: data.BEAMS
div.p: Description: One or more from the list given in the definition of the BEAM entity.

list.head: restriction of list of data.BEAM
list.item: minLength 1

div.head: data.BEAT
div.p: Description: A beat location, i.e., [0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)? The value must fall between 0 and the numerator of the time signature + 1, where 0 represents the left barline and the upper bound represents the right barline. For example, in 12/8 the value must be in the range from 0 to 13.

list.head: restriction of xs:decimal
list.item: minInclusive 0

div.head: data.BEATRPT.REND
div.p: Description: Visual and performance information for a repeated beat symbol.
union of(restriction of xs:positiveInteger, restriction of xs:token)

div.head: data.BEND.AMOUNT
div.p: Description: Either a decimal value or a token. The decimal values are limited to .25, .5, .75, or 1, while the token values are restricted to 'full'.
union of(restriction of xs:decimal, restriction of xs:token)

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: true
false

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: high
medium
low
unknown

div.head: data.CLEFSHAPE
div.p: Description: Clef shape attribute values (Read, p.53-56)

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: G
GG
F
C
perc
TAB

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: whbox
blbox

div.head: data.COLOR
div.p: Description: Either a hexadecimal color value, ie., x[0-9A-Fa-f]{6,6} OR a descriptive word, i.e., aqua, black, blue, fuchsia, gray, green, lime, maroon, navy, olive, purple, red, silver, teal, white, or yellow, for colors defined by the HTML 4.01 specification.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pattern "(x[0-9A-Fa-f]{6,6}|aqua|black|fuchsia|gray|green|lime|maroon|navy|olive|purple|red|silver|teal|white|yellow)"

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: medium
wide
dashed
dotted

div.head: data.DEGREES
div.p: Description: 360th-unit measure of a cirle's circumference; optionally signed decimal number, i.e., [+-]?[0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?

div.head: data.DURATION
div.p: Description: Logical, that is, written, duration attribute values for the CMN repertoire. Whole note duration = '1'.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: long
breve
maxima
longa
brevis
semibrevis
minima
semiminima
fusa
semifusa

div.head: data.ENCLOSURE
div.p: Description: Enclosures for editorial notes and accidentals

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: paren
brack

div.head: data.FINGER.FRET
div.p: Description: In a guitar chord diagram, a label indicating which finger, if any, should be used to play an individual string. The values 'x' and 'o' indicated stopped and open strings, respectively.
union of(restriction of xs:positiveInteger, restriction of xs:token)

div.head: data.FONTFAMILY
div.p: Description: Font family (for text) attribute values. Mup-acceptable values: avantgarde, bookman, courier, helvetica, newcentury, palatino, times.

div.head: data.FONTNAME
div.p: Description: Font name (for text) attribute values. Mup-acceptable values: rom, ital, bold, boldital

div.head: data.FONTSTYLE
div.p: Description: Font style (for text) attribute values. 'normal' = 'rom' in Mup.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: ital
normal
oblique

div.head: data.FONTWEIGHT
div.p: Description: Font weight (for text) attribute values

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: bold

div.head: data.FRET
div.p: Description: In a guitar chord diagram, the fret where the finger should be placed. Since guitar chord diagrams are limited to the range of frets that fall under the hand, the value here is also limited. The pos (position) attribute on the chorddef element must be used to indicate at which fret this range begins.

list.head: restriction of xs:positiveInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 5
minInclusive 1

div.head: data.FRETNUMBER
div.p: Description: In string tablature, the fret number, i.e., [1-9]. The value 'o' may be used instead of a numerica value to indicate the open string.
union of(restriction of xs:nonNegativeInteger, restriction of xs:token)

div.head: data.GLISSANDO
div.p: Description: Analytical glissando attribute values: i(nitial), m(edial), t(erminal)

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: i
m
t

div.head: data.GRACE
div.p: Description: Do grace notes get time from the current (acc) or previous (unacc) one?

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: acc
unacc

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: quarter
half
whole
dblwhole
filldiamond
diamond
dwdiamond
fillisotriangle
isotriangle
dwhisotriangle
fillpiewedge
piewedge
dwhpiewedge
fillrectangle
rectangle
dwhrectangle
fillrtriangle
rtriangle
dwrtriangle
fillurtriangle
urtriangle
dwurtriangle
fillsemicircle
semicircle
dwsemicircle
fillslash
slash
dwslash
x
blank
circlex
cross

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: liquescent1
liquescent2
tied
tiedliquescent1
tiedliquescent2

div.head: data.INEUMENAME
div.p: Description: Interrupted neume, i.e. neume written as 2 or more sub-neumes

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pessubpunctis
climacus
scandicus
bistropha
tristropha
pressusminor
pressusmaior

div.head: data.INTEGERNONNEGATIVE
div.p: Description: Unsigned positive integer values including '0', i.e., [0-9]+

div.head: data.INTEGERPOSITIVE
div.p: Description: Unsigned positive integer values excluding '0', i.e., 1 to infinity.

div.head: data.ISODATE
div.p: union of(xs:date, xs:gYear, xs:gMonth, xs:gDay, xs:gYearMonth, xs:gMonthDay, xs:time, xs:dateTime, restriction of xs:token)

div.head: data.ISOTIME
div.p: Description: ISO 24-hour time format: HH:MM:SS.ss, i.e., [0-9][0-9]:[0-9][0-9]:[0-9][0-9](\.?[0-9]*)?

div.head: data.KEYSIGNATURE
div.p: Description: Key signature may be indicated by a value showing where the key is in the circle of fifths. Mixed key signatures, e.g. those consisting of a mixture of flats and sharps, and key signatures with unorthodox placement of the accidentals (Read, p. 143) must be indicated by setting the key.sig attribute to 'mixed' and providing explicit keysig info in the key.sig.mixed attribute.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pattern "mixed|0|[1-7][f|s]"

div.head: data.KEYSIGTOKEN
div.p: Description: A token describing the pitch name, inflection, and octave number of an altered pitch in a key signature.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pattern "[a-g][s|f|ss|x|ff|n|nf|ns|su|sd|fu|fd|nu|nd][0-9]"

div.head: data.LAYERSCHEME
div.p: Description: Indicates how stems should be drawn when more than one layer is present and stem directions are not indicated on the notes/chords themselves. '1' indicates that there is only a single layer on a staff. '2o' means there are two layers with opposing stems. '2f' indicates two 'free' layers; that is, opposing stems will be drawn unless one of the layers has 'space'. In that case, stem direction in the remaining layer will be determined as if there were only one layer. '3o' and '3f' are analogous to '2o' and '2f' with three layers allowed. What about more than 3 layers?

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: 2o
2f
3o
3f

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: recta
obliqua

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: narrow
medium
wide
dashed
dotted
wavy

div.head: data.MEASUREBEAT
div.p: Description: A duration expressed as a count of measures plus a beat location, i.e., [0-9]+m *\+ *[0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?, e.g., dur="1m + 3.5" indicates a duration of 1 measure plus 3 and one half beats or, in other words, on the 2nd half of the 3rd beat of the next measure. The measure number must be in the range of 0 to the number of remaining measures and the beat number must be in the range from 0 to the numerator of the time signature plus 1. For example, for an event starting in the first measure of a piece containing 6 measures in 6/8, the measure number must be between 0 to 5 and the beat number must be within the range from 0 to 7, e.g., "4m+3".

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: C
O

div.head: data.METERSIGN
div.p: Description: Meter.sym attribute values for CMN notation

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: common
cut

list.head: restriction of xs:positiveInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 16

div.head: data.MIDITEMPO
div.p: Description: MIDI quarter notes per minute: positive integer in the range 10-1000

list.head: restriction of xs:positiveInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 1000
minInclusive 10

div.head: data.MIDIVALUE
div.p: Description: MIDI values are in the following range

list.head: restriction of xs:nonNegativeInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 127

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: major
minor
dorian
phrygian
lydian
mixolydian
aeolian
locrian

list.head: restriction of xs:positiveInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 3
minInclusive 2

list.head: restriction of xs:positiveInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 3
minInclusive 2

div.head: data.NUMBER
div.p: Description: Optionally signed decimal number, i.e., [+-]?[0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?

div.head: data.NUMBERPOSITIVE
div.p: Description: Unsigned positive decimal values excluding '0', i.e., 1 to infinity.

list.head: restriction of xs:decimal
list.item: minInclusive 1

div.head: data.OCTAVE
div.p: Description: Oct attribute values. The default values conform to Acoustical Society of America representation. Read, p. 44.

list.head: restriction of xs:nonNegativeInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 9

div.head: data.OCTAVE.DIS
div.p: Description: The amount of octave displacement; that is, '8' (as in '8va' for 1 octave), '15' (for 2 octaves), or rarely '22' (for 3 octaves).

div.head: data.ORIENTATION
div.p: Description: Rotation or reflection of base symbol values.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pattern "reversed|90CW|90CCW"

div.head: data.PAGE.PANELS
div.p: Description: The number of panels per page.

list.head: restriction of xs:positiveInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 2
minInclusive 1

div.head: data.PERCENT
div.p: Description: Positive decimal number plus '%', i.e., [0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?\%

div.head: data.PGSCALE
div.p: Description: Page scale factor. Page.scale may be expressed as a percentage of a programmatically-determined "usual" size or as a ratio of virtual units to real-world units.

div.head: data.PGUNITS
div.p: Description: Values for real-world unit attributes

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: in
cm
mm

list.head: restriction of xs:nonNegativeInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 11

div.head: data.PITCHNAME
div.p: Description: The pitch names (gamut) used within a single octave. The default values conform to Acoustical Society of America representation.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pattern "[a-g]"

div.head: data.PITCHNAME.GES
div.p: Description: Gestural pitch names need an additional value for when the notated pitch is not to be sounded.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pattern "[a-g]|none"

div.head: data.PITCHNUMBER
div.p: Description: Pnum (pitch number, e.g. MIDI) attribute values

div.head: data.PLACE
div.p: Description: Place, i.e., location of musical material relative to a staff.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: above
below

list.head: restriction of xs:positiveInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 3
minInclusive 2

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: normal
cue

div.head: data.SLASH
div.p: Description: The number of slashes to be rendered for tremolandi.

list.head: restriction of xs:positiveInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 6
minInclusive 1

div.head: data.SLUR
div.p: Description: i=initial, m=medial, t=terminal. Number is used to match endpoints of the slur when slurs are nested or overlap, e.g. <note slur='i1 i2'/><note slur='t1'/><note slur='t2'/> encodes the fact that two slurs begin on note 1, one which terminates on note 2 and one which terminates on note 3.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pattern "[i|m|t][1-6]"

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: up
down

div.head: data.SLURS
div.p: Description: One or more from the list given in the definition of data.SLUR.

list.head: restriction of list of data.SLUR
list.item: minLength 1

div.head: data.STAFFLOC
div.p: Description: Staff location. Staff location includes staff lines, spaces, and the spaces directly above and below the staff. The value ranges between 0 (just below the staff) to 2 * number of staff lines (directly above the staff). For example, on a 5-line staff the lines would be numbered 1,3,5,7, and 9 while the spaces would be numbered 0,2,4,6,8,10.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: up
down

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: 1slash
2slash
3slash
4slash
5slash
6slash
sprech
z

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: left
right
center

div.head: data.STRINGNUMBER
div.p: Description: In string tablature, the number of the string to be played, i.e., [1-9]+.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: equal
just
mean
pythagorean

div.head: data.TEMPOVALUE
div.p: Description: Beats (meter signature denominator) per minute, e.g. 120.

list.head: restriction of xs:positiveInteger
list.item: maxInclusive 3
minInclusive 2

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: box
circle
dblunderline
none
quote
slash
smcaps
strike
sub
sup
underline

div.head: data.TIE
div.p: Description: Tie attribute values: initial, medial, terminal

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pattern "[i|m|t]"

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: up
down

div.head: data.TIES
div.p: Description: One or more from the list given in the definition of data.TIE.

list.head: restriction of list of data.TIE
list.item: minLength 1

div.head: data.TSTAMPOFFSET
div.p: Description: A positive or negative offset from the value given in the tstamp attribute in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

div.head: data.TUPLET
div.p: Description: Tuplet attribute values: initial, medial, terminal

list.head: restriction of xs:token

list.head: restriction of list of data.TUPLET

rectangular
rhombic
tied

div.head: data.URI
div.p: Description: a Uniform Resource Identifier, see [RFC2396]

div.head: data.VISUALOFFSET
div.p: Description: Visual, i.e. ho and vo, offsets are expressed in terms of staff interline distance; that is, in "stepsizes", which are half the distance between staff lines.

list.head: restriction of xs:token
list.item: pattern "1.9b"
